analyzed: 'dir ni len pa po sdug bsngal gyis zil gyis mnan pas sbyin bdag gi 'bras bu khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro //

original: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa la sbyin pa byin na rnam par smin pa gzhal du med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du @93a * //

analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa la byin na ches gzhal du med do zhes bya ba nas /

original: de bas kyang dgra bcom pa la byin na ches gzhal du med pa yin na rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phul na lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya bar bsdu ste /
analyzed: de bas kyang dgra bcom pa la byin na ches gzhal du med pa yin na rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phul na lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya bar bsdu ste /

original: gzhal du med pa bas kyang gzhal du med par 'gyur te gangg'a dang rgya mtsho'i chu bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa bas kyang gzhal du med par 'gyur te gangg'a dang rgya mtsho'i chu bzhin no //

original: yang ji ltar 'di rnam par smin pa brgya 'gyur ram stong 'gyur ram gzhal du med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'di rnam par smin pa brgya 'gyur ram stong 'gyur ram gzhal du med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does the result of giving become a hundredfold, a thousandfold or incalculable?

original: bsod snyoms pa la sogs pas len pa po'i tshe la sogs pa dag ji tsam 'phel ba de brgya 'gyur ram stong 'gyur ram dpag tu med par lha dang mi dag gi nang du sbyin bdag gi tshe la sogs pa dag mngon par 'grub pa min te /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa la sogs pas len pa po'i tshe la sogs pa dag ji tsam 'phel ba de brgya 'gyur ram stong 'gyur ram dpag tu med par lha dang mi dag gi nang du sbyin bdag gi tshe la sogs pa dag mngon par 'grub pa min te /
translated: When the lifespan and so on of the recipient increases by a hundredfold, a thousandfold or incalculably through taking up the life of a bhik·π£u and so on, the lifespan and so on of the donor is not established in the realms of gods and humans by a hundredfold, a thousandfold or incalculably.

original: de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyin bdag sbyin pa pos len pa po dag la zas sbyin pa na gnas lnga sbyin par byed ces bya ba rgyas pa nas tshe sbyin pas lha dang mi'i tshe thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyin bdag sbyin pa pos len pa po dag la zas sbyin pa na gnas lnga sbyin par byed ces bya ba rgyas pa nas tshe sbyin pas lha dang mi'i tshe thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said, ‚ÄúWhen a donor or benefactor gives food to recipients, he gives five things.‚Äù

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩpha ma dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / pha ma dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: phan 'dogs pa dag la gnod pa byas pa'i 'bras bu mthong bas lan du phan 'dogs pa'i 'bras bu rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dag la gnod pa byas pa'i 'bras bu mthong bas lan du phan 'dogs pa'i 'bras bu rjes su dpag par bya'o //

original: dom dang ri dvags la sogs pa'i skyes rabs la sogs pa dper bya'o zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dom dang ri dvags la sogs pa'i skyes rabs la sogs pa dper bya'o zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: The JƒÅtakas of the bear, the deer, and so on are examples.

original: 'jig rten na zang zing gi sbyin pa thams cad pas chos kyi sbyin pa mchog tu bshad pa de bzhin du zang zing gi sbyin pa thams cad kyi nang nas zang zing gi sbyin pa 'di yang mchog ste grol bas grol ba la zhes bya ba'o //

original: byang chub sems dpas zhes bya ba la 'di yang sems can thams cad kyi don yin pa'i phyir dang snying rjes rab tu bcug pa'i phyir dang / sred pas yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir phul du byung ba yin no //

original: gzhan dag na re /

analyzed: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa rab tu ston par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /

translated: The meaning of the uncontaminated Dharma body isüîΩthe meaning of the path.

analyzed: lam skye ba'i sngon rol tu lung 'bogs pa 'gro ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzhi ni las kyi lam mo zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //

original: ji ltar lci bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lci bar 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause the maturation is fixed.‚Äù

analyzed: ma byin par blangs pa la sogs pas ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /

original: ji ltar zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na ;

analyzed: la la ni sbyor ba'i khyad par kho nas lci bar 'gyur te /
translated: Some become heavy merely through the specific preparation.

analyzed: rnam par smin pa nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro // la la ni sems pa'i khyad par gyis so //

analyzed: la la ni bsam pa'i khyad par gyis so //

analyzed: blo sngon du ma btang ba yang ma yin la zhes bya ba la blo sngon du ma btang ba ni @94a * //

original: lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: bab col du byas pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dper na smra ba la drag tu brtsad pas brdzun smra ba lta bu ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di ni blo sngon du ma btang ba'i rnam grangs kho na yin no zhes zer ro //

translated: Nonvirtuous karma is also of three types: that which is nonvirtuous by nature, that which is nonvirtuous by association, and that which is nonvirtuous by concomitance.

original: rnam par smin pa la ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la ji lta bu zhe na /

original: gnas skabs ma nges kyang rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs ma nges kyang rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though the state is not definite, there is karmic maturation.

original: de bzhin du dge ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The virtuous should be applied in the same way.üîΩKarma that is intentional, complete,üîΩwithout regret, without antidote,

original: ched du bsams nas byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ched du bsams nas byas pa yin gyi /

original: blo sngon du ma btang ba ni ma yin te /

analyzed: de ni blo sngon du ma btang bas lung du ma bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: That is not done consciously, so it is neutral.üîΩKarma that is complete is karma that is finished, not karma that is not finished.

original: de ni byas pa yin gyi bsags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni byas pa yin gyi bsags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This action is done, but not accumulated.

original: blo sngon du btang zin kyang bab col du yin na ni byas pa yin gyi bsags pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: blo sngon du btang zin kyang bab col du yin na ni byas pa yin gyi bsags pa ni ma yin te /

analyzed: dper na smra ba la drag tu brtsad pas bden pa smra ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the truthful person who, in the course of a discussion, kills a mosquito without noticing it.

analyzed: kha cig ni legs par spyad pa gcig gis bde 'gror 'gro la /

original: rdzogs pa ni bsags pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs pa ni bsags pa yin no //

original: las de ni yid la gcags pa med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: las de ni yid la gcags pa med pa yang yin te /

analyzed: 'ga' zhig dge ba byas nas @94b kyang 'gyod par 'gyur ba de ni byas pa yin gyi bsags pa ma yin no //

analyzed: gnyen po med pa ni sbyin pa byin nas mi smod pa na'o //

original: gnas skabs ma nges kyang rnam par smin pa nges pa yang yin te ma nges pa ni byas pa yin gyi bsags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs ma nges kyang rnam par smin pa nges pa yang yin te ma nges pa ni byas pa yin gyi bsags pa ma yin no //
translated: When one has given a gift and then regrets it, the action is accumulated but not done.üîΩWhen one has given a gift and does not regret it, the action is done and accumulated.

translated: ‚ÄúAttachment to existence, to enjoyments, and to honor‚Äù means

analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams kyis ji lta bu yin pa de lta ni legs pa yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /

analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams kyi ltar na phra rgyas dang bcas pa spong bar byed do zhes bya ba ni mdo dang 'gal ba med mod kyi 'on kyang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas yin pas phra rgyas ldan pa ma yin par bral bar 'gyur ro snyam pa
translated: The Sautrantikas say, ‚ÄúIt is not contradictory to say that one abandons that which possesses negative tendencies, but we think that one is separated from that which possesses negative tendencies by the antidote that abandons attachment to pleasure.‚Äù

original: de spang ba'i phyir phra rgyas ni mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la ldan pa ma yin pa yang ma yin gyi zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de spang ba'i phyir phra rgyas ni mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la ldan pa ma yin pa yang ma yin gyi zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: To abandon that view, the root text says, ‚ÄúNegative tendencies are neither concomitant nor nonconcomitant.‚Äù

original: rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir zhe na rdzas gzhan gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir zhe na rdzas gzhan gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because they are not a different substance.

original: nyal ba zhes bya ba la rang gi 'bras bu sems kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs par mi byed pa'i phyir nyal ba zhes bya la rgyu'i dngos por rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir phra rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyal ba zhes bya ba la rang gi 'bras bu sems kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs par mi byed pa'i phyir nyal ba zhes bya la rgyu'i dngos por rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir phra rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúlying‚Äù because it does not cause its own result, such as an afflicted mind, and it is called ‚Äúproclivity‚Äù because it is related to the state of being a cause.

original: sad pa zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur pa ste rang gi 'bras bu sems kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa byed par nus pa'i phyir sad pa zhes bya la sems rang dbang med par byed pa'i phyir kun nas dkris pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sad pa zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur pa ste rang gi 'bras bu sems kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa byed par nus pa'i phyir sad pa zhes bya la sems rang dbang med par byed pa'i phyir kun nas dkris pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúarisen‚Äù because it is manifest, and it is called ‚Äúentanglement‚Äù because it is able to cause its own result, such as an afflicted mind, and because it makes the mind unfree.

original: nyal ba dang sad pa yang ma grub pas de la nyal ba gang yin zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par dris so //
analyzed: nyal ba dang sad pa yang ma grub pas de la nyal ba gang yin zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par dris so //
translated: Since neither lying nor arising is established, it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is lying?‚Äù and so on.

original: mngon sum du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon sum du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is called ‚Äúunmanifest‚Äù because it is not manifest.

original: mngon sum du ma gyur pa sa bon gyi ngo bo yin pas khyad par yod de 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i sa bon gyi dngos po ni de'i gnyen po skye ba med par nam yang rten ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du ma gyur pa sa bon gyi ngo bo yin pas khyad par yod de 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i sa bon gyi dngos po ni de'i gnyen po skye ba med par nam yang rten ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: There is a difference, because the state of being a seed is not manifest. The state of being a seed of the passion of attachment, etc. is never reversed in the life-stream, even when the antidote to that has arisen.

original: sa bon gyi dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni sa bon gyi dngos po zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩlus kyi zhes bya ba rgyas @101b par 'byung ste 'dir lus ni rten no //
analyzed: sa bon gyi dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni sa bon gyi dngos po zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o // lus kyi zhes bya ba rgyas @101b par 'byung ste 'dir lus ni rten no //
translated: The question, ‚ÄúWhat is the state of being a seed?‚Äù is asked because the nature of the state of being a seed is not established.

original: nyon mongs pa las skyes pa nyon mongs pa skye ba'i mthu yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las skyes pa nyon mongs pa skye ba'i mthu yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The passage continues, ‚ÄúThe body is the basis. The power to generate passion is generated from passion.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'jug pa rten ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa skye ba dang mthun par byed cing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'jug pa rten ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa skye ba dang mthun par byed cing /
translated: Passion is the engagement of the basis, because it makes the future passion conform to its generation.

original: de dang mthun pa'i rten de las kyang rkyen lhag ma yong na slar nyon mongs pa skye'o //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i rten de las kyang rkyen lhag ma yong na slar nyon mongs pa skye'o //
translated: And from that basis which is in conformity with that, if the remaining conditions are present, passion is generated again.

original: de'i phyir rten gyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gang zhig nyon mongs pa'i nus pa sa bon gyis nyon mongs pa skye ba dang mthun pa de ni nyon mongs pa las skyes pa nyon mongs pa skye ba'i mthu zhes bya ba la /

translated: Therefore, the special state of the basis that is compatible with the generation of affliction through the seed of the potential for affliction is called the generation of affliction, the power to generate affliction.

original: de ni mi rtag pa dang 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa ltar brtag pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir rten de las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi rtag pa dang 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa ltar brtag pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir rten de las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa yin no //
translated: Since it is a phenomenon that is to be investigated, like impermanence, being a result, and so on, it is inexpressible as either the same as or different from that basis.

original: gal te brtag par yod na 'o na nyon mongs pa las skyes pa'am nyon mongs pa skyed par mi rung ngo zhe na rgyu dang 'bras bu rdzas su yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te brtag par yod na 'o na nyon mongs pa las skyes pa'am nyon mongs pa skyed par mi rung ngo zhe na rgyu dang 'bras bu rdzas su yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it exists as an object of investigation, then it is not suitable to arise from affliction or to generate affliction, because cause and effect substantially exist.

original: 'di ni de lta ma yin te rang nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu rnams la rten skye ba na nyon mongs pa'i nus pa las nyon mongs pa skye ba dang rjes su mthun par skye bas rten nyid de'i phyir bar gyi 'bras bu dang nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de lta ma yin te rang nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu rnams la rten skye ba na nyon mongs pa'i nus pa las nyon mongs pa skye ba dang rjes su mthun par skye bas rten nyid de'i phyir bar gyi 'bras bu dang nus pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the power is the result and the cause of the defilement.

original: rten gyi khyad par nyid las nyon mongs pa skye'i nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten gyi khyad par nyid las nyon mongs pa skye'i nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The defilement arises from the special power, not from the power itself.

original: gzhan du na rten gyi khyad par nyid rgyu dang rten gyi khyad par nyid 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na rten gyi khyad par nyid rgyu dang rten gyi khyad par nyid 'bras bu ste /
translated: Otherwise, the special power would be the cause and the special power itself would be the result.

original: nyon mongs pa ni shes par mi nus pas de nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pa las skyes ba dang nyon mongs pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni shes par mi nus pas de nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pa las skyes ba dang nyon mongs pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Since the defilement cannot be known, it is explained that the power to generate the defilement arises from the defilement.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

analyzed: gal te gnas ngan len de nyid phra rgyas so zhe na de ni 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: If that negative reflex is the negative tendency, that is accepted.

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a special state.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba de la slob dpon 'dus bzad kyis mang du bshad pa de yang phal cher sbyar bar bya ba ma yin pas gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs pas dngos su nye bar ma bkod do //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba de la slob dpon 'dus bzad kyis mang du bshad pa de yang phal cher sbyar bar bya ba ma yin pas gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs pas dngos su nye bar ma bkod do //
translated: ‚ÄúNot concomitant‚Äù is explained by Master Sa·πÖghabhadra in many ways, but most of it is not relevant, so fearing too many words, I have not set it forth directly.

original: rnam par bshad pa nyid du dgag pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa nyid du dgag pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: You should understand the refutation in the commentary.

analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i shes pa las skyes pa dran pa skyed pa'i mthu zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe power to produce memory that arises from the consciousness that experiences‚Äù means

analyzed: 'dis ni 'dir dpe dang dpe can mtshungs so zhes grags te /
translated: that here the example and the example-possessor are similar, it is well known.

original: de nyid la smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid la smras pa /

analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dran pa nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúThe memory that arises together with the experience

analyzed: 'di shes pa dang lhan cig pa'i dran pa skyed pa'i nus par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: is accepted as the power to produce memory that is simultaneous with consciousness.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs @102a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs @102a * //
translated: Afflictions

analyzed: pa rnams las ni rdzas kyi rgyun tha dad pa'i bdag nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: do not exist as a self that is a separate substance from the continuum.

original: kha cig tu de dang lhan cig pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rdzas la nyon mongs pa skyed pa'i nus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu de dang lhan cig pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rdzas la nyon mongs pa skyed pa'i nus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In some places, the substance of the defilement that is concomitant with that is called the ‚Äúpower to generate defilement.‚Äù

original: bsgrub bya dang dper brjod pa mtshungs pa med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsgrub bya dang dper brjod pa mtshungs pa med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The example is not similar to the probandum.

original: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i khyad par las nyon mongs pa skyed pa mi ldan pa ma yin pa'i phra rgyas te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i khyad par las nyon mongs pa skyed pa mi ldan pa ma yin pa'i phra rgyas te /
translated: ‚ÄúSimilar‚Äù means that the power to generate defilement is the proclivity that is not devoid of the special power.

original: de la 'di ni dpe ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di ni dpe ma yin no //

original: nus pa'i khyad par ma yin pa las skyes pa ni dran pa ma yin pas mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med do //
analyzed: nus pa'i khyad par ma yin pa las skyes pa ni dran pa ma yin pas mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med do //
translated: Memory is not produced from what is not a special power, so there is no difference in the characteristics.

original: 'di ltar nyams su myong ba'i shes pas dran pa'i rgyud la rang gi yul dmigs pa ni dran pa'i sa bon te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyams su myong ba'i shes pas dran pa'i rgyud la rang gi yul dmigs pa ni dran pa'i sa bon te /

analyzed: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i yul la dmigs te dran pa skye'o zhes khas blang bar bya'o //

analyzed: de lta ma yin na nyams su myong ba'i shes pas don med do //

analyzed: gzhan yang nyams su myong ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba thams cad lhan cig skyes pa'i sems dang sems las skyes pa'i tshogs pa de nyid du gzung ba na /
translated: Moreover, all that is called ‚Äúconsciousness that experiences‚Äù is the mind that is born together with the mental factors and the group of mental factors.

original: shes pa kho na 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa kho na 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: When it apprehends, it is not consciousness alone,

analyzed: rang gi yul la dmigs pa'i dran pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs pa mtha' dag skyed pa la gtso bo ste rang gi rten gyi nus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Memory that focuses on its own object is the principal cause for the production of the entire group of mind and mental factors. It is called the ‚Äúpotential of its own basis.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir yang dran pa skye bas 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dran pa skye bas 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /

analyzed: dran pa'i sa bon la sogs pa ni rang gi rigs kyi rgyu ba las tha dad ma yin par brjod par bya la /
translated: The seeds of memory, etc., should be described as not different from the cause of its own type.

original: kha cig ni de dag 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ji ltar dran pa skye bar brjod ces zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni de dag 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ji ltar dran pa skye bar brjod ces zer ro //

original: 'o na mdo las zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'i ste /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'i ste /
translated: The extensive passage from a sutra cited by the Vaibhasikas is as follows:

original: drug tshan drug ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: drug tshan drug ces bya ba ni /
translated: Six sets of six

original: der gsungs pa /
analyzed: der gsungs pa /
translated: are stated there:

original: de la gang zhig bde ba'i tshor bas reg cing mngon par dga' mgu lhag par zhen te gnas pa 'di'i 'dod chags ni bde ba'i tshor ba las rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //

original: mngon par dga' ba ni 'dir 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba ni 'dir 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas zhes gsungs la /
translated: Manifest delight is stated in the sutra to be the negative tendency of attachment.

original: mngon par dga' ba yang bde ba'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa de'i phyir phra rgyas ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho na yin gyi mthu'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba yang bde ba'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa de'i phyir phra rgyas ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho na yin gyi mthu'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Since manifest delight is concomitant with the feeling of pleasure, negative tendencies are only concomitant states and not states of power.

original: 'gyur ro @102b zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de kho na ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'gyur ro @102b zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de kho na ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: mngon du gyur pa'i gnas skabs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the case that the state of manifest delight is not a negative tendency.

original: de lta ma yin na de 'dod chags las rgyas so zhes gsungs par 'gyur gyi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de 'dod chags las rgyas so zhes gsungs par 'gyur gyi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would say ‚Äúit increases from attachment,‚Äù but it does not say that.üîΩWhen it says ‚Äúwhile sleeping,‚Äù it means ‚Äúwhile abiding in the state of a seed.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe nyal ba zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi dngos pos gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / sad pa na 'gyur ro zhes mi ston par nyal ba zhes mngon par 'dod pa ci zhes bya ba rgol ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyal ba zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi dngos pos gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / sad pa na 'gyur ro zhes mi ston par nyal ba zhes mngon par 'dod pa ci zhes bya ba rgol ba'i tshig go //

original: 'dir sad pa na 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sad pa na 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ma yin no //

original: 'o na bde ba'i tshor ba las 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bde ba'i tshor ba las 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that attachment increases from the feeling of pleasure,

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa las 'gyur ro zhes bya'i da ltar byung ba ni ma yin no //

original: yang na 'di ni rgyu la nye bar btags pa yin par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni rgyu la nye bar btags pa yin par zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas kyi rgyu ste /

original: gnas brtan 'dus bzang na re de nyid kyang da ltar ba'i dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'di brtag par mi bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnas brtan 'dus bzang na re de nyid kyang da ltar ba'i dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'di brtag par mi bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The elder Sa·πÉghabhadra says that this is not to be analyzed, because it is untenable that a present thing is a cause.

original: de nyid kun nas dkris pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phra rgyas ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kun nas dkris pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phra rgyas ma yin no //
translated: It is not a negative tendency that has the characteristic of being a fetter.

original: 'di la skyon med de /
analyzed: 'di la skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault in this explanation.

analyzed: mthong ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dbyer med par 'chad 'dod pas de ltar bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the statement that seeing is a cause is that the cause and effect are inseparable.

translated: Similarly, the negative tendency of ignorance is like attachment and so on, for it is the distinctive cause of both and it is abandoned by the path of seeing because it focuses on objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it focuses on the truths of suffering and so on.

original: de'i phyir gzhan du brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du brjod do //
translated: Therefore it is stated elsewhere.

original: sdug bsngal gyi yul mthong ba ni sdug bsngal mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi yul mthong ba ni sdug bsngal mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing the object of suffering is seeing suffering.

original: de yang chos shes pa'i bzod pa dag gis spang bar bya bas ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang chos shes pa'i bzod pa dag gis spang bar bya bas ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that which is to be abandoned by the receptivity to the cognition of the doctrine is to be abandoned by seeing suffering.

original: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bar yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bar yang de bzhin no //
translated: That which is to be abandoned by seeing the path is the same.

original: lta ba'i gzhi ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i shes la goms pa las gang spong bar byed pa de bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lta ba'i gzhi ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i shes la goms pa las gang spong bar byed pa de bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The basis of view is that which is to be abandoned by the path of meditation, since it is to be abandoned by the path of meditation that is cultivated through familiarity with the knowledge of the four truths.

original: 'dir gang zhig dngos su log par lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i phra rgyas bden pa rnams la log par zhugs pa de la mchog tu 'dzin pa nyid med pas de'i dbang du byas nas 'dri ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir gang zhig dngos su log par lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i phra rgyas bden pa rnams la log par zhugs pa de la mchog tu 'dzin pa nyid med pas de'i dbang du byas nas 'dri ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, since the negative tendencies that are not like wrong view itself do not grasp the four truths as supreme, they are not mentioned in the question.

original: gang kho na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa kho na la the tshom za bas 'dod chags pa bzhin du dri ba byed do //
analyzed: gang kho na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa kho na la the tshom za bas 'dod chags pa bzhin du dri ba byed do //
translated: However, since doubt is similar to attachment and so on, it is asked about in the same way as attachment.

original: 'di la skyon med de gang bshad pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas gzhom par bya ba sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la skyon med de gang bshad pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas gzhom par bya ba sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ste /
translated: There is no fault here, because the doubt that is to be conquered by the perseverance for knowing dharmas with regard to the truth of suffering is the doubt that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of suffering.

original: 'dir de'i gnas skabs kho na the tshom ste bden pa rnams la log par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir de'i gnas skabs kho na the tshom ste bden pa rnams la log par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, doubt is just the state of that, because it is wrongly engaged with the truths.

original: 'di ci ltar des gzhom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci ltar des gzhom par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be conquered by that?

original: de'i phyir 'di skad nges par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad nges par brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, this should be stated:

original: gang dag gang mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa de dang de ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag gang mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa de dang de ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever is focused on that which is to be abandoned by seeing, that is called to be abandoned by seeing.

original: lhag ma ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The rest are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa rnams la rnam pa dang bye brag dang khams kyi dbye bas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa rnams la rnam pa dang bye brag dang khams kyi dbye bas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Attachment, anger, pride, and ignorance are classified by aspect, by type, and by realm.

original: rnam pa'i dbye bas ni bcur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbye bas ni bcur 'gyur te /
translated: They are ten by the classification of aspect.

original: lta ba'i phra rgyas la rnam pa'i dbye bas lngar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba'i phra rgyas la rnam pa'i dbye bas lngar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the negative tendencies of afflicted view are established as five by means of the classification of aspect.

original: bye brag gi dbye bas ni sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur @105a * //
analyzed: bye brag gi dbye bas ni sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur @105a * //
translated: They are classified as thirty-six by means of specific classification.

original: te ; bye brag gi dbye bas kyang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: te ; bye brag gi dbye bas kyang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: They are also classified by means of specific classification, from those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering up to those to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: khams kyi dbye bas ni dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: khams kyi dbye bas ni dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: They are classified as ninety-eight by means of realm classification.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na sum cu rtsa drug go / gzugs kyi khams na sum cu rtsa gcig ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na sum cu rtsa drug go / gzugs kyi khams na sum cu rtsa gcig ste /
translated: There are thirty-six in the desire realm, thirty-one in the form realm,

original: khong khro rnam pa lnga ma gtogs so //
analyzed: khong khro rnam pa lnga ma gtogs so //
translated: excluding the five types of anger.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as being the same in the formless realm.

original: yang ci'i phyir khams kyi dbye bas phra rgyas brtsi ba'i dbye bas ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir khams kyi dbye bas phra rgyas brtsi ba'i dbye bas ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they counted as ninety-eight by means of realm classification and not by means of specific classification?

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams na phra rgyas rnams dngos po gcig gis rgyas pa med pa de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa rnams su yang gzhan du sems so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams na phra rgyas rnams dngos po gcig gis rgyas pa med pa de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa rnams su yang gzhan du sems so //
translated: Just as in the realm of desire there is no single thing that increases all the proclivities, in the same way, in the first and second meditation, there is no single thing that increases all the proclivities.

original: gnyen po gcig pa des ni de ltar 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: gnyen po gcig pa des ni de ltar 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa rnams so //
translated: The proclivities of the realm of desire and of the first meditation are abandoned by the same counterac-tive path.üîΩBut the proclivities of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality are not abandoned by the same counteractive path.

original: de lta na yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams tha dad par mi 'grub ste gnyen po gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams tha dad par mi 'grub ste gnyen po gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The proclivities of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality are not abandoned by the same counteractive path, for the counteractive path is of the stage of the meditation.üîΩThe proclivities of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality are not abandoned by the same counteractive path, for the counteractive path is of the stage of the meditation.üîΩThe proclivities of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality are not abandoned by the same counteractive path, for the counteractive path is of the stage of the meditation.üîΩThe proclivities of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality are not abandoned by the same counteractive path, for the counteractive path is of the stage of the meditation.üîΩThe proclivities of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality are not abandoned by the same counteractive path, for the counteractive path is of the stage of the meditation.üîΩThe proclivities of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality are not abandoned by the same counteractive path, for the counteractive path is of the stage of the meditation.üîΩThe proclivities of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality are not abandoned by the same counteractive path, for the counteractive path is of the stage of the meditation.üîΩThe proclivities of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality are not abandoned by the same counteractive path, for the counteractive path is of the stage of the meditation.

original: gal te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams rim gyis gnyen po bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid du grub po zhe na de ni sa rnams la mtshungs so //üîΩde'i phyir be sha te tsa tu be sha te tsa tu ra sh'i te shtse ti grantha:ka ra n'i ya ai ti /
analyzed: gal te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams rim gyis gnyen po bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid du grub po zhe na de ni sa rnams la mtshungs so // de'i phyir be sha te tsa tu be sha te tsa tu ra sh'i te shtse ti grantha:ka ra n'i ya ai ti /
translated: The proclivities of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality are not abandoned by the same counteractive path, for the counteractive path is of the stage of the meditation.

original: de lta na yang skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The proclivities of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality are not abandoned

original: khams la sogs pa'i dbye bas mtshams sbyor rnams dgu bcu rtsa brgyad ces bshad do //
analyzed: khams la sogs pa'i dbye bas mtshams sbyor rnams dgu bcu rtsa brgyad ces bshad do //
translated: It is explained that the nine fetters that connect one to the desire realm and so on are the ninety eight anusayas.

original: gal te ci'i phyir de lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir de lta bu zhe na /
translated: Why are they called fetters?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba yongs su shes pa'i dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir dang phra rgyas spang ba'i phyir rgyu gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag go / gnyis po yang sems kyi sa la chags pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir de'i dbye bas
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yongs su shes pa'i dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir dang phra rgyas spang ba'i phyir rgyu gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag go / gnyis po yang sems kyi sa la chags pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir de'i dbye bas
translated: They are posited as fetters for two reasons: because they are the result of the system of training in the knowledge of the aspects of the truths and because they are the result of abandoning negative tendencies.

original: phra rgyas rtsi bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phra rgyas rtsi bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not counted as negative tendencies because they are not associated with the level of the mind.

original: sngon rabs pa rnams na re /
analyzed: sngon rabs pa rnams na re /
translated: The former teachers say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin rnams rnam par gzhag pa de la kha cig gis de lta bu'i bsam gtan pa bzhi'i nyon mongs pa gcig tu bsdus nas gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang de bzhin du gzugs med pas gzhi la gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags zhesüîΩbshad do zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin rnams rnam par gzhag pa de la kha cig gis de lta bu'i bsam gtan pa bzhi'i nyon mongs pa gcig tu bsdus nas gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang de bzhin du gzugs med pas gzhi la gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags zhesüîΩbshad do zer ro //
translated: In the system of the Tathagata, some combine the afflictions of the four absorptions into one and explain that attachment to form and attachment to the formless are the two attachments.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: yang de lta bus 'jig rten mtha' dag gis ji ltar bsdus @105b zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang de lta bus 'jig rten mtha' dag gis ji ltar bsdus @105b zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, how is the entire world included in the four continents?

original: gzhan dag ni de lta bu ni bcom ldan 'das kho nas mkhyen no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de lta bu ni bcom ldan 'das kho nas mkhyen no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The Blessed One alone knows this.

original: 'di la 'di brjod par nus te /
analyzed: 'di la 'di brjod par nus te /
translated: Here, this can be said:

original: gang gi phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu spangs pas yongs su shes pa rnam par gzhag phyin chad dbye ba rtogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu spangs pas yongs su shes pa rnam par gzhag phyin chad dbye ba rtogs par mi bya ste /
translated: Because the complete knowledge of the abandonment of the least of the least of the afflictions of the fourth absorption is established, the classification should not be understood beyond that.

original: de dag rigs mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rigs mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they belong to the same type.

original: de lta ma yin na bsam gtan dang po spangs pa la yang yongs su shes pa rnam par bzhag na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bsam gtan dang po spangs pa la yang yongs su shes pa rnam par bzhag na /
translated: If it were otherwise, then complete knowledge would be established even in the abandonment of the first absorption.

original: de rnam par gzhag pa rtog pa spang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnam par gzhag pa rtog pa spang ba ma yin no //
translated: But its establishment would not be the abandonment of conceptualization.

original: nges par de'i rigs can gyi nyon mongs pa gzhan spang ba ma yin no ;
analyzed: nges par de'i rigs can gyi nyon mongs pa gzhan spang ba ma yin no ;
translated: It is certain that other afflictions belonging to that type are not abandoned.

original: / gang 'di rang gi sa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin yang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhin du lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: / gang 'di rang gi sa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin yang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhin du lta bar bya'o //
translated: Although it is not concomitant with its own level, it should be viewed as if it were concomitant.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las ni gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rigs ma lus pa de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su shes pa rnam par gzhag go / gzhan dag na re sa dang khams rnams la nyon mongs pa'i dbyeüîΩbas med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las ni gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rigs ma lus pa de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su shes pa rnam par gzhag go / gzhan dag na re sa dang khams rnams la nyon mongs pa'i dbye bas med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: They are not classified by the afflictions of the levels and realms.

original: de lta na so so skye bo bsam gtan bzhi bar skyes pa nyon mongs pa can rnams rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: de lta na so so skye bo bsam gtan bzhi bar skyes pa nyon mongs pa can rnams rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro gsungs pa yang /
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that ordinary beings born in the fourth absorption would possess investigation, analysis, joy, and pleasure.üîΩAlso, it is said:

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir dga' ba med cing bde ba yang spangs te zhes so //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir dga' ba med cing bde ba yang spangs te zhes so //
translated: Because investigation and analysis are pacified, there is no joy and pleasure is abandoned.

original: sa gong ma'i nyer bsdogs sa 'og ma'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen por mi 'gyur te 'ching ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa gong ma'i nyer bsdogs sa 'og ma'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen por mi 'gyur te 'ching ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The access concentrations to higher levels would not be the antidote that abandons the afflictions of lower levels because they are not the same binding agent.

original: gang yang bsam gtan dang po thob pa'i phyir mi 'ong nas bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i bar spang ba mtshungs pas de'i phyir nges par 'di khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang bsam gtan dang po thob pa'i phyir mi 'ong nas bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i bar spang ba mtshungs pas de'i phyir nges par 'di khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Also, because nonreturners who obtain the first absorption and those who obtain the fourth absorption abandon the same objects to be abandoned, they definitely must accept this.

original: khams rnams bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang las rgyu dang 'bras bus sa rnams yongs su bcad pas de'i phyir kun tu sbyor ba gcig gis grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag gis phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du rnam par gzhag
analyzed: khams rnams bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang las rgyu dang 'bras bus sa rnams yongs su bcad pas de'i phyir kun tu sbyor ba gcig gis grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag gis phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du rnam par gzhag
translated: Just as the realms are differentiated by the causes and results of affliction and karma, the levels are also differentiated by the causes and results of affliction and karma. Therefore they are not established by one fetter alone.

original: go / gzugs kyi khams de nyid na khong khro med do zhes bshad na 'o na de'i phyir gong na khong khro med ce na /üîΩde'i phra rgyas kyi @106a * //
analyzed: go / gzugs kyi khams de nyid na khong khro med do zhes bshad na 'o na de'i phyir gong na khong khro med ce na / de'i phra rgyas kyi @106a * //
translated: If anger does not exist in the form realm, then why is it said that anger does not exist above that?

original: dngos po med de /
analyzed: dngos po med de /
translated: Because it has noüîΩpotential.

original: khong khro ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba las rgyas par 'gyur ba yin na de yang gong na med pas mi srid do //
analyzed: khong khro ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba las rgyas par 'gyur ba yin na de yang gong na med pas mi srid do //
translated: Anger increases from the feeling of pain, but that does not exist above that realm.

original: de la khong khro ni zhe sdang dang rlung gi nad rtsub po ltar yin na /
analyzed: de la khong khro ni zhe sdang dang rlung gi nad rtsub po ltar yin na /
translated: Anger is like a violent wind and bile disease.üîΩThose sentient beings are moistened by the moisture of serenity, and thus they do not have unpleasant karmic maturation.

original: sems can de dag ni rgyud zhi gnas kyis brlan pas rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba med pa'i phyir dang / gang gi phyir khams de dag tu rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba dang bral bas kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po med pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag ni rgyud zhi gnas kyis brlan pas rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba med pa'i phyir dang / gang gi phyir khams de dag tu rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba dang bral bas kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po med pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And they do not have the basis for malice, because they are free from unpleasant karmic maturation in those realms.

original: de la phyi rol gyi lcags dang 'gyur byed dang tsher ma la sogs pa med cing /
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi lcags dang 'gyur byed dang tsher ma la sogs pa med cing /
translated: There are no external things such as iron, copper, thorns, and so on.

original: nang gi rlung dang brjod byed la sogs pa yang med de /
analyzed: nang gi rlung dang brjod byed la sogs pa yang med de /
translated: And there are no internal things such as wind and speech.

original: byams pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas bsgos pa'i phyir dang yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas bsgos pa'i phyir dang yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are moistened by the root of the wholesome of loving kindness and so on, and because they do not grasp.

original: srid rtse las skyes bzod pa yis //
analyzed: srid rtse las skyes bzod pa yis //
translated: The patience that arises from the summit of existence

original: gzhom bya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhom bya zhes bya ba la /
translated: is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: srid rtse smos pa ni de las gzhan pa'i sa las skyes pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid rtse smos pa ni de las gzhan pa'i sa las skyes pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the summit of existence is to distinguish it from the patience that arises from other stages.

original: bzod pa mos pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa mos pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Patience of belief is to be abandoned by the path of meditation in order to eliminate objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: chos kyi bzod pa la thal bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi bzod pa la thal bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Patience of Dharma is to be abandoned by the path of seeing in order to eliminate the possibility of its arising.

original: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas gzhom par bya ba zhes bya ba smos so ;
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas gzhom par bya ba zhes bya ba smos so ;
translated: Patience of subsequent knowledge is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: / srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po'i 'jig rten pa'i lam med pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho na yin gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po'i 'jig rten pa'i lam med pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho na yin gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is to be abandoned by the path of seeing alone, because there is no mundane path that is an antidote to the summit of existence.

original: sa lhag ma dag na ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa dag na re ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar dag na'o //
analyzed: sa lhag ma dag na ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa dag na re ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar dag na'o //
translated: In the remaining levels, it is to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm and so on, up to the base of nothingness, as is appropriate.

original: ci rigs par ni ji ltar srid par te /
analyzed: ci rigs par ni ji ltar srid par te /
translated: As is appropriate means as is possible.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni chos shes pa'i bzod pas spang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni chos shes pa'i bzod pas spang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: In the desire realm it is to be abandoned by perseverance for Dharma knowledge.

original: bsam gtan dang po yan chad ni rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas gzhom par bya ba yin no //

original: gal te de ltar na 'o na ni ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i lta ba kun tu 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na 'o na ni ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i lta ba kun tu 'byung zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how do views focusing on the desire realm arise for those free from attachment?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de dag lta ba skye ba dang dus mnyam du nyams pa'i phyir te lhas byin bzhin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de dag lta ba skye ba dang dus mnyam du nyams pa'i phyir te lhas byin bzhin no //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Because those views degenerate simultaneously with their arising, like Devadatta.

original: dper na lhas byin gyis dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na lhas byin gyis dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, Devadatta was not able to lead the sa·πÖgha of fully ordained monks.

original: bcom ldan 'das la thugs las chung ngur bzhugs par gsol nas sdig pa'i bsam pa'i rnam pa skyes nas rdzu 'phrul las yongs su nyams pa de bzhin du de dag kyang lta ba kun tu 'byung bas yongs su nyams pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la thugs las chung ngur bzhugs par gsol nas sdig pa'i bsam pa'i rnam pa skyes nas rdzu 'phrul las yongs su nyams pa de bzhin du de dag kyang lta ba kun tu 'byung bas yongs su nyams pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: In the same way, they fall due to the arising of views.

original: mdo las ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: mdo las ni 'di skad du /
translated: But a sutra states:

original: de nas lhas byin rnyed pa bkur stis zil gyis non nas sems yongs su gtugs te /
analyzed: de nas lhas byin rnyed pa bkur stis zil gyis non nas sems yongs su gtugs te /
translated: Then Devadatta, overcome by the pride of gain and honor, became obsessed with the thought:

original: kye ma @108b ma la bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la dag slong gi dge 'dun byin kyang ci ma rung /
analyzed: kye ma @108b ma la bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la dag slong gi dge 'dun byin kyang ci ma rung /
translated: ‚ÄúOh, how nice it would be if the Bhagavan would give me the Sangha of monks!üîΩI would make the Sangha of monks my retinue and request the Bhagavan to remain in good health and to remain in comfort in this life.‚Äù

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun ni bdag gi 'khor du byas la bcom ldan 'das ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang ldan zhing thugs las chung ngur gnas par gsol lo snyam pa de lta bu'i sdig pa can gyi bsam pa'i rnam pa de skyes so
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun ni bdag gi 'khor du byas la bcom ldan 'das ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang ldan zhing thugs las chung ngur gnas par gsol lo snyam pa de lta bu'i sdig pa can gyi bsam pa'i rnam pa de skyes so
translated: Such an evil thought arose in him.

original: // lhas byin gyis sems de bskyed ma thag tu rdzu 'phrul de las yongs su nyams su zhes bya ba rgya chen 'byung ste /
analyzed: // lhas byin gyis sems de bskyed ma thag tu rdzu 'phrul de las yongs su nyams su zhes bya ba rgya chen 'byung ste /
translated: As soon as Devadatta gave rise to this thought, he immediately lost his supernormal powers.

original: de bzhin du de dag kyang lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa kun tu rgyu bas yongs su nyams par bshad pa de nyid kyi phyir lta ba skyed pa dang dus mnyam du yongs su nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de dag kyang lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa kun tu rgyu bas yongs su nyams par bshad pa de nyid kyi phyir lta ba skyed pa dang dus mnyam du yongs su nyams pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, these supernormal powers are explained as lost through the defilement of views.

original: gal te yongs su nyams pa na ci ltar de bhu mishtha nyid du mtshon par byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te yongs su nyams pa na ci ltar de bhu mishtha nyid du mtshon par byed ce na /
translated: If one loses them, how can one be called a master of the superknowledges?

original: myur du skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ste /
analyzed: myur du skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ste /
translated: Because one quickly produces them again.üîΩIf one loses them through cultivation, why does one lose them?üîΩThis is a rhetorical question.

original: gal te de ltar goms pas las ci'i phyir yongs su nyams zhes bya ba rgol ba'i tshig go / de la glan ka 'di khas ma blangs pa'i phyir 'dir 'ga' skyed pa med do //
analyzed: gal te de ltar goms pas las ci'i phyir yongs su nyams zhes bya ba rgol ba'i tshig go / de la glan ka 'di khas ma blangs pa'i phyir 'dir 'ga' skyed pa med do //
translated: Since one does not accept this criticism, there is no need to answer it.

original: drishta yo bi tad byu mishtha ae bi ti aa st'u b'a de'i rgyu mtshan legs par bzung nas myur du skyed pa'o //
analyzed: drishta yo bi tad byu mishtha ae bi ti aa st'u b'a de'i rgyu mtshan legs par bzung nas myur du skyed pa'o //
translated: One is called a master of the superknowledges because one quickly produces them again after apprehending the reason for their loss.

original: de'i rigs gzhan goms pa med pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro ;üîΩ/'di ltar srid pa'i rtse mo thob pa yang de ltar thag ring ba'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i phyir khyad par las khyad par gyi cha dang mthun par te /
analyzed: de'i rigs gzhan goms pa med pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro ; /'di ltar srid pa'i rtse mo thob pa yang de ltar thag ring ba'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i phyir khyad par las khyad par gyi cha dang mthun par te /
translated: Since they do not cultivate other types, they fully degenerate.

original: bsam gtan dang po las sems gcig gis yongs su nyams par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po las sems gcig gis yongs su nyams par byed do //
translated: Thus, one who obtains the summit of existence fully degenerates by one mind due to cultivating the antidote to the distant level, since it is superior to the summit of existence.

original: gal te phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa brgyad nges par mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa brgyad nges par mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba yin na /
translated: If the twenty-eight negative tendencies are definitely objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing,

original: 'o na ci'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad cu rtsa brgyad ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad cu rtsa brgyad ces bya zhe na /
translated: why are there eighty-eight objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing?

original: brjod par bya ste 'di ni dgongs pa can te rim gyis pa la mngon par dgongs nas bshad do //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste 'di ni dgongs pa can te rim gyis pa la mngon par dgongs nas bshad do //
translated: This is a statement with an implied meaning, since it is explained with the gradual type in mind.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam gyi byed pa la yang dgongs te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam gyi byed pa la yang dgongs te /
translated: It is also stated with the function of the uncontaminated path in mind.

original: ci yang med kyi skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams mthong ba'i lam gyis de'i bral ba'i thob pa mngon du byed pa srid pa'i phyir de ltar bshad pa yin no //üîΩrtag par 'du shes pa dang ril por 'du shes pa spang ba'i phyir de skad du bshad de zhes bya ba la 'jig ces @109a * //
analyzed: ci yang med kyi skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams mthong ba'i lam gyis de'i bral ba'i thob pa mngon du byed pa srid pa'i phyir de ltar bshad pa yin no // rtag par 'du shes pa dang ril por 'du shes pa spang ba'i phyir de skad du bshad de zhes bya ba la 'jig ces @109a * //
translated: because it is possible that those who are free from attachment up to the sphere of nothingness manifest the acquisition of freedom from those through the path of seeing.üîΩIt is explained in that way in order to abandon the notion of permanence and the notion of a whole.

original: bya ba ni rtag par 'du shes pa spang ba'i phyir bstan to //
analyzed: bya ba ni rtag par 'du shes pa spang ba'i phyir bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is taught in order to abandon the notion of permanence.

original: tshogs zhes bya ba ni ril por 'du shes pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs zhes bya ba ni ril por 'du shes pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is in order to abandon the notion of a whole.

original: de dag sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are preceded by those.

original: rtag pa dang ril por 'du shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang ril por 'du shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang ril por 'du shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang ril por 'du shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can no //
translated: They are preceded by the notion of permanence and the notion of a whole.

original: de dang bral bas bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang bral bas bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: Through being free from those, one is free from the grasping of self.

original: rgyu med pas 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pas 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no cause, there is no effect.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa lnga char yang ngo //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa lnga char yang ngo //
translated: All that has a focus on the contaminated is the five types.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa las kyang khyad par du byed pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa las kyang khyad par du byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhas a focus on the contaminated‚Äù is used to distinguish this from the focus on the uncontaminated.

original: 'jig tshogs zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe perishable‚Äù refers to the five aggregates that are grasped.

original: thams cad 'jig tshogs kyi yul can yin bzhin du ci'i phyir bdag dang bdag gir lta ba kho na la 'jig tshogs su lta bar bshad ce na /
analyzed: thams cad 'jig tshogs kyi yul can yin bzhin du ci'i phyir bdag dang bdag gir lta ba kho na la 'jig tshogs su lta bar bshad ce na /
translated: Since all of these have the perishable as their object, why is only the view of a real self and the view of a real being called the view of the perishable?

original: bdag dang bdag gir med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is explained in order to demonstrate that there is no real self and no real being.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ci nas kyang 'di ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin gyi bdag dang bdag gi ba ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ci nas kyang 'di ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin gyi bdag dang bdag gi ba ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For this very reason, the root text states, ‚ÄúIn order to make it understood that this is the view of the perishable and not the view of a real self and a real being.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid la khungs ni ji skad du dge slong dag ces rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid la khungs ni ji skad du dge slong dag ces rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The scriptural source for this is found in the passage from the sutra that states, ‚ÄúMonks, the view of a real self is the perishable.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag na re 'dir 'jig pa'i sgra don med de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dir 'jig pa'i sgra don med de /
translated: Others say that the word ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is meaningless here,

original: mi rtag pa nyid du ni tshogs kyi sgras shes pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du ni tshogs kyi sgras shes pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because impermanence is understood from the word ‚Äúcollection.‚Äù

original: 'dus pa rtag par 'dod par 'ga' yang med pas tshogs su lta ba kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'dus pa rtag par 'dod par 'ga' yang med pas tshogs su lta ba kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: But since no one believes that a collection is permanent, the view is only of a collection.

original: 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: phung po rnams la dngos po gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir dang de'i nye bar len pa rnams rtag pa dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phung po rnams la dngos po gcig pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir dang de'i nye bar len pa rnams rtag pa dgag pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the aggregates are refuted as a single entity and their appropriation is refuted as permanent.

original: rtag par 'du shes pa dang ril por 'du shes pa spang ba'i phyir zhes sngar nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: rtag par 'du shes pa dang ril por 'du shes pa spang ba'i phyir zhes sngar nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained above, in order to abandon the notion of permanence and the notion of a whole.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang 'dod pas gnas brtan rnams kyis skyon bstan pa'i gnas med do //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang 'dod pas gnas brtan rnams kyis skyon bstan pa'i gnas med do //
translated: Since both of these are accepted, the elders have no basis for teaching a fault.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: yod do zhes bya ba 'dus pa'i tshogs yod pa ste gcig ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod do zhes bya ba 'dus pa'i tshogs yod pa ste gcig ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt exists‚Äù means that the collection of aggregates exists, but it is not a single thing.

original: bdag yod pa nyid kyi 'jug pa 'dir lta ba de yang med pa de'i phyir yod @109b par ma gyur ba la dmigs pas /
analyzed: bdag yod pa nyid kyi 'jug pa 'dir lta ba de yang med pa de'i phyir yod @109b par ma gyur ba la dmigs pas /
translated: In this context, the view of the self is nonexistent. Therefore, the object of the view is nonexistent.

original: de'i don du 'jig pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: de'i don du 'jig pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is used in the sense of the object of the view.

original: 'o na 'jig pa'i yul nyid la bdag yod par grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'jig pa'i yul nyid la bdag yod par grub po zhe na /
translated: If the self is established as the object of destruction,

original: de'i phyir tshogs kyi sgra ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs kyi sgra ste /
translated: then the word ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is used.

original: bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis lus thams cad dam lus so so la bdag gcig nyid du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis lus thams cad dam lus so so la bdag gcig nyid du brjod pa'o //
translated: The proponents of the self say that the self is one in all the bodies or in each body.

original: 'di tshogs ma yin zhes bya ba lus su ma gyur pa rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa nyid ni 'jig pa la dmigs pa nyid de bdag yod pa nyid du zhes so //
analyzed: 'di tshogs ma yin zhes bya ba lus su ma gyur pa rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa nyid ni 'jig pa la dmigs pa nyid de bdag yod pa nyid du zhes so //
translated: This is not a collection. The consciousness that is not a body is the object of the view of destruction. The self is established as the object of the view of destruction.

original: gzhan rnams su yang 'jig tshogs la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan rnams su yang 'jig tshogs la dmigs pa ste /
translated: In other s≈´tras, the view of the transitory collection is the view of the self.

original: rang la bdag gir lta ba kho na 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya'i gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang la bdag gir lta ba kho na 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya'i gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: The view of the self as one‚Äôs own is the view of the transitory collection. The view of the self as another is not the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'dir yang 'jig pa smos pa las tha dad pa'i tshogs yod pa nyid du rtog par byed pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'jig pa smos pa las tha dad pa'i tshogs yod pa nyid du rtog par byed pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Here, too, there is no one who conceives of the collection as existing separately from the disintegration.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa la lta ba zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa la lta ba zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should not be said that it is the view of the collection, but rather the view of the collection of the perishable.

original: gnas brtan rnams kyi skyon 'di thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gnas brtan rnams kyi skyon 'di thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: This fault would ensue for the elders.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad log par zhugs pas log par bcug pa phyin ci log gi 'jug pa ste yang dag pa'i lta ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad log par zhugs pas log par bcug pa phyin ci log gi 'jug pa ste yang dag pa'i lta ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all are engaged in error, they are led to error, that is, to the engagement of error, in order to remove the correct view.

original: thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: All refers to the view of the collection of the perishable, and so on.

original: yang ji ltar gcig kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar gcig kho na yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is it just one?

original: phyin ci log gi 'jug pa phul du byung ba dang ldan pa de'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi 'jug pa phul du byung ba dang ldan pa de'i phyir bshad do //
translated: It is explained because it possesses the preeminent engagement of error.

original: 'di ni skur pa 'debs par byed pa yin la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni skur pa 'debs par byed pa yin la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the denigrator,

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa yod pa las med do zhes lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa yod pa las med do zhes lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it views the existence of the truths of suffering and so on as nonexistent.

original: gzhan ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pas bdag la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pas bdag la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Others superimpose, because the afflicted views of the self and so on superimpose a self and so forth.

original: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rtag par lta ba yang tha dad du brjod par bya 'am zhe na /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rtag par lta ba yang tha dad du brjod par bya 'am zhe na /
translated: Since it is said, ‚ÄúWhatever is impermanent is suffering,‚Äù should the view of permanence be mentioned separately?

original: brjod par mi bya ste rtag par lta ba de bdag gi dbang du byas nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: brjod par mi bya ste rtag par lta ba de bdag gi dbang du byas nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro /
translated: It should not, because the view of permanence engages in terms of the self.

original: 'di rtag par lta ba ma yin no zhes bya ba rgol ba'i tshig go /'di la 'ga' zhig gis lan smras pa /
analyzed: 'di rtag par lta ba ma yin no zhes bya ba rgol ba'i tshig go /'di la 'ga' zhig gis lan smras pa /
translated: This is not the view of permanence is a statement of objection.

original: bdag kho na'i dbang du byas nas mthar 'dzin par lta ba ste /
analyzed: bdag kho na'i dbang du byas nas mthar 'dzin par lta ba ste /
translated: Someone replies: The extreme view engages in terms of the self alone.

original: 'dis mthar byas pa ma yin yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i stobs kyis bskyed de zhugs pa'i phyir de @110a * //
analyzed: 'dis mthar byas pa ma yin yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i stobs kyis bskyed de zhugs pa'i phyir de @110a * //
translated: Although this is not the view of the extreme, it is generated by the power of the afflicted view of the self and engages in terms of the self.

original: nyid bdag gi par mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: nyid bdag gi par mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore it is asserted to be the view of the self.

original: dngos po'i sgo nas rtag pa'am chad par lta ba ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po'i sgo nas rtag pa'am chad par lta ba ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba nyid do //
translated: The view of eternalism or nihilism in regard to things is the extreme view.

original: mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam pa yang mthar 'dzin bar lta ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam pa yang mthar 'dzin bar lta ba'o //
translated: The view that what is impermanent is permanent is also the extreme view.

original: sdug bsngal la bde ba'o snyam pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bde ba'o snyam pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view that what is suffering is happiness is the overesteeming of morality and austerities.

original: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rtag par lta ba yang bshad par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rtag par lta ba yang bshad par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The view of eternalism should be understood to be explained as the view that what is impermanent is permanent, because it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is impermanent is suffering.‚Äù

original: 'dir phyin ci log gi 'jug pa thams cad log par lta ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir phyin ci log gi 'jug pa thams cad log par lta ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, all the operations of error are the wrong view.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are abandoned by the noble ones.

original: zhes bya ba ni dor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbecause they are abandoned‚Äù is ‚Äúbecause they are rejected.‚Äù

original: sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù is not explicitly stated.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni lta pa tsam zhig la mchog nyid du 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni lta pa tsam zhig la mchog nyid du 'dzin pa ma yin te /

translated: Therefore, it is said that just that is erroneous,üîΩbut not feeling, etc.üîΩThe cause of the errors is called wisdom.üîΩThe idea of permanence, etc. with

translated: Therefore, one who thinks i possess good qualities when one possesses faults and is inflated due to faulty conduct is wrong pride.

original: gzhan dag ni ma tu pa rkyen du byas nas na nya'i dgag pa'i don brjod par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma tu pa rkyen du byas nas na nya'i dgag pa'i don brjod par byed de /
translated: Others, taking the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù as a reason, explain the meaning of the negation ‚Äúnot‚Äù as follows.

original: bdag nyid kyi yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan kun tu sems pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan kun tu sems pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The thought that one possesses true qualities that one does not possess is false pride.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang log pa'i nga rgyal dag gi khyad par brjod @117b par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang log pa'i nga rgyal dag gi khyad par brjod @117b par bya ste /

original: sa bon med pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / sa bon dang bcas pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: sa bon med pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / sa bon dang bcas pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Overweening pride is the absence of a seed; false pride is the presence of a seed.

original: mtha' dag la sgro 'dogs pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad la sgro 'dogs pa log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: mtha' dag la sgro 'dogs pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad la sgro 'dogs pa log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Overweening pride is the exaggeration that one possesses all good qualities; false pride is the exaggeration that one possesses a few good qualities.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: bdag tu lta ba las gzhan log par mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba'i sems khengs pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba las gzhan log par mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba'i sems khengs pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo zhes zer ro //
translated: False pride is the inflation of the mind preceded by a wrong view other than the view of self.

original: gzhan dag na re /üîΩyang dag pa'i dngos pos mtho ba ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re / yang dag pa'i dngos pos mtho ba ni nga rgyal lo //

original: chung dus ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: chung dus ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride is the inflation of the mind that thinks, ‚ÄúI am superior‚Äù in relation to an inferior.üîΩOverweening pride is the inflation of the mind that thinks, ‚ÄúI am superior‚Äù in relation to an equal.

original: dam pa ma yin pas ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pas ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo //

original: nye bar len pa'i phung pa lnga la bdag dang sdug pa mngon du 'gro ba'i nga'o snyam du sems pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / yon tan thob ba chung ngus rab tu gyur par sems pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / nyung du yongs su gzung ba'i phyir cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang bdag skye bo ngan pa'i yon tan dang ldan no snyam pa log pa'i nga rgyal lo zhes zer ro //

translated: The thought that the five appropriated aggregates are the self and the dear one is the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù The thought that one has obtained a small quality is the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am superior.‚Äù The pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am a little‚Äù is due to grasping a small amount. The pride of thinking ‚ÄúI have the qualities of a bad person‚Äù is false pride.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe varieties of pride‚Äù means the different types of pride.

original: nga rgyal gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi bye brag go / de la dang po gsum ni lta ba la brten pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lta bas rab tu bcug pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi bye brag go / de la dang po gsum ni lta ba la brten pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lta bas rab tu bcug pa'o //
translated: The first three are called ‚Äúbased on views‚Äù because they are induced by views.

original: de la bdag mchog yin no snyam pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten pa lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag mchog yin no snyam pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten pa lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: Among them, the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am superior‚Äù is a variety of excessive pride based on the view of the transitory collection.

original: mnyam pa las bdag mchog go snyam pa ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid las so //
analyzed: mnyam pa las bdag mchog go snyam pa ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid las so //
translated: The idea that one is superior to one's equals is the definition of excessive pride.

original: bdag dang 'dra'o snyam pa ni lta ba la brten pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'dra'o snyam pa ni lta ba la brten pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa'o //

original: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam mo snyam pa ni nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid las so //
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam mo snyam pa ni nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid las so //

original: bdag pas dman no snyam pa ni der lta ba la brten pa nyid de mthong ba'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa'o //üîΩkhyad par du 'phags pa las bdag dman no snyam pa ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid las so //

analyzed: bdag pas mchog yod do snyam pa ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa las so //

analyzed: bdag dang 'dra ba yod do snyam pa ni nga rgyal gyi rnam pa las so //

analyzed: bdag pas dman pa yod do snyam pa lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa las so //

original: bdag bas mchog med do snyam @118a * //üîΩpa ni nga rgyal gyi rnam pa las so //üîΩbdag dang 'dra ba med do snyam pa ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa las so //

translated: Thus, even though faith and so on, the faculties of sleep and suffering, and the eyes and so on are abandoned, they are still active. Even though some are not abandoned, they are not active, like the entanglements of killing and so on.
