analyzed: lung las kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na chos nyon mongs pa can rnams so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: What are phenomena that arise from the cause of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing? They are afflicted phenomena.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa can thams cad mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu can yin na kun tu 'gro ba spangs pa rnams bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa kun tu spyod par mi 'gyur zhing nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i ngaüîΩrgyal la sogs pa bzhin de dag kyang kun tu @121a * //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa can thams cad mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu can yin na kun tu 'gro ba spangs pa rnams bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa kun tu spyod par mi 'gyur zhing nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la sogs pa bzhin de dag kyang kun tu @121a * //
translated: If all afflicted states possess the cause of being objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, then it would follow that the afflicted states to be abandoned by the path of meditation would not be engaged in by those who have abandoned the omnipresent cause of being objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: spyod par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: spyod par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It would follow that they would be engaged in, just as the aspects of pride and the pride thinking i and so on are.

original: spangs pa'i phyir yang rgyu las 'bras bu skye ba 'ba' zhig ma yin la /
analyzed: spangs pa'i phyir yang rgyu las 'bras bu skye ba 'ba' zhig ma yin la /
translated: It is not only the case that results arise from causes that have been abandoned.

original: ma spangs pa nyid kyi phyir dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa spangs ba'i phyir nga rgyal gyi rnam pa la sogs pa rnams kyi so sor brtags min gyi 'gog pa thob par byed do //
analyzed: ma spangs pa nyid kyi phyir dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa spangs ba'i phyir nga rgyal gyi rnam pa la sogs pa rnams kyi so sor brtags min gyi 'gog pa thob par byed do //
translated: Because they are not abandoned and because the view of the transitory collection, etc. are abandoned, one obtains the non-analytical cessation of the aspects of pride, etc.

original: cig shos la 'di dag ma yin zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi rnam pa la sogs pa 'di dag cig shos la mtshungs pa ma yin pas skyon med de /
analyzed: cig shos la 'di dag ma yin zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi rnam pa la sogs pa 'di dag cig shos la mtshungs pa ma yin pas skyon med de /
translated: There is no error in saying that these are not the others, because these aspects of pride, etc. are not the same as the others.

original: yang kun tu 'gro ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang kun tu 'gro ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúpervading‚Äù?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad la dmigs pa'i don to //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad la dmigs pa'i don to //
translated: It means that they focus on all contaminated things.

original: rnam pa lnga thams cad zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga thams cad zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: All five types are contaminated things.

original: 'di gang yin pa de ltar skye ba dag med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di gang yin pa de ltar skye ba dag med ces bya ba la /
translated: They arise in that way, but not in all cases.

original: 'dir rang gi rgyud kyi tshor ba bdag tu nye bar 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rang gi rgyud kyi tshor ba bdag tu nye bar 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: Here, one‚Äôs own feelings do not approach the self.

original: 'o na de nyid chos ci las skyes she na /
analyzed: 'o na de nyid chos ci las skyes she na /
translated: Then, from what dharma does that self arise?

original: de ltar legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad par yod par mthong ba las skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad par yod par mthong ba las skye'o //
translated: Thus, it arises from seeing that good conduct and bad conduct exist.

original: de ni 'di ltar 'gyur te bdag gi las dang 'bras bu las byung ba'i nus pa thams cad bye brag med par 'byin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'gyur te bdag gi las dang 'bras bu las byung ba'i nus pa thams cad bye brag med par 'byin no //
translated: It is like this: it produces all the potencies that arise from action and result without distinction.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang brtags pa la rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang brtags pa la rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: Attachment, etc., engage what is seen, heard, and cognized.

original: gang gis grong gi chos spyod pa las 'dod chags skye'o //
analyzed: gang gis grong gi chos spyod pa las 'dod chags skye'o //
translated: Attachment arises from the practice of village customs.

original: 'di ni de'i kha dog dang dbyibs kyi khyad par dang bgrod pa dang nyal ba rnams la zhugs pa las ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i kha dog dang dbyibs kyi khyad par dang bgrod pa dang nyal ba rnams la zhugs pa las ma yin te /
translated: This is not from engaging the particularities of color and shape, the gait, and the lying down of that person.

original: de dag ni kun tu 'gro ba'i phra rgyas kyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni kun tu 'gro ba'i phra rgyas kyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those are based on the pervasive negative tendencies.

original: de ltar kun tu 'gro ba'i don bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar kun tu 'gro ba'i don bshad do //
translated: Thus, the meaning of pervasive is explained.

original: tshogs pa mtha' dag gi dbang du byas pa'i phra rgyas ni rgyu la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas kyi ngo bos kun tu 'gro ba de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshogs pa mtha' dag gi dbang du byas pa'i phra rgyas ni rgyu la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas kyi ngo bos kun tu 'gro ba de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
translated: The negative tendencies that are objects of the power of the entire assembly are the essential nature of negative tendencies that focus on the cause and those concomitant with them.

original: rgyu la dmigs pa'i ngo bo dag kho na de'i rigs can te rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rgyu la dmigs pa'i ngo bo dag kho na de'i rigs can te rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: Those that focus on the essential nature of the cause are the same type as it, since they have the same essential nature as the cause.

original: lta ba gzhan dag la rang gi khams mtha' dag la dmigs pa srid par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: lta ba gzhan dag la rang gi khams mtha' dag la dmigs pa srid par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Other views can focus on the entire realm of one‚Äôs own realm,üîΩbut it is not possible for the overesteeming of morality and asceticism to do so.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa la ni ma yin no snyam ste 'dri ba ni su zhig 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa la ni ma yin no snyam ste 'dri ba ni su zhig 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Who can possess all the afflictions of the desire realm?

original: mtha' dag gis zhes bya ba ni gnas nyi shu dbye bas tha dad pas so //
analyzed: mtha' dag gis zhes bya ba ni gnas nyi shu dbye bas tha dad pas so //
translated: All means all twenty bases, which are differentiated by type.

original: @121b mtha' dag rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur yid ches par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: @121b mtha' dag rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur yid ches par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One can have confidence that all are causes, but they are not causes.

original: gang la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa kun tu 'gro ba rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba zhes bya bar bsam pa'o //
analyzed: gang la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa kun tu 'gro ba rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba zhes bya bar bsam pa'o //
translated: The thought is: ‚ÄúWhat is the universal that is posited as the overesteeming of morality and asceticism?‚Äù

original: gnas kyi dbye ba tha dad pas mtha' de dag cig car du dmigs so zhes ni mi zer ro //
analyzed: gnas kyi dbye ba tha dad pas mtha' de dag cig car du dmigs so zhes ni mi zer ro //
translated: We do not say that the extremes are simultaneously apprehended by the different categories of abodes.

original: 'on kyang rnam pa lnga char po yang mtha' dag cig car dmigs pas kun tu 'gro ba yin par smra'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa lnga char po yang mtha' dag cig car dmigs pas kun tu 'gro ba yin par smra'o //
translated: However, we say that the universal is that which is simultaneously apprehended in all five aspects.

original: gal te rnam pa lnga po nyid 'dod pa'i khams yin pas 'dir lan ci zhig btab par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa lnga po nyid 'dod pa'i khams yin pas 'dir lan ci zhig btab par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the five aspects are the desire realm, what answer can be given here?üîΩThe answer is that the five aspects are simultaneously apprehended.

original: lan ni rnam pa lnga'i cha la cig car du dmigs so zhes bya ba 'di yin no zhes slob dpon chos kyi bshes gnyen zer ro //
analyzed: lan ni rnam pa lnga'i cha la cig car du dmigs so zhes bya ba 'di yin no zhes slob dpon chos kyi bshes gnyen zer ro //
translated: This is what Master Dharmasubhuti says.

original: de yang mi shes pas sems kyi rgyud rnams la zhes smos te /
analyzed: de yang mi shes pas sems kyi rgyud rnams la zhes smos te /
translated: Since that is not known, he says ‚Äúin the mindstreams of those who do not know that.‚Äù

original: gal te dbang phyug chen po rgyu'i sgo nas 'jig rten rnams kyi rgyur lta ba dang tshangs pas dag par lta ba de'i tshe rnam pa lnga po yang cig car du dmigs so //
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug chen po rgyu'i sgo nas 'jig rten rnams kyi rgyur lta ba dang tshangs pas dag par lta ba de'i tshe rnam pa lnga po yang cig car du dmigs so //
translated: If one views Mahe≈õvara as the cause of the world, or BrahmƒÅ as the purifier, then all five aspects are perceived simultaneously.üîΩHowever, it is said that where there is the view of self, there is craving for self.

original: de lta na yang gang la bdag tu lta ba yod pa de la bdag la sred pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bdag tu lta ba yod pa de dag kho na la bdag la sred pa yod de /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang la bdag tu lta ba yod pa de la bdag la sred pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bdag tu lta ba yod pa de dag kho na la bdag la sred pa yod de /
translated: Craving for self exists only in those who have the view of self in the five appropriated aggregates,

original: de dag ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those aggregates are the basis of attachment to self.

original: gang la mchog dang dag par lta ba yod pa de la de don du gnyer ba yod cing des kyang nga rgyal du 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gang la'o //
analyzed: gang la mchog dang dag par lta ba yod pa de la de don du gnyer ba yod cing des kyang nga rgyal du 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gang la'o //
translated: It is said that where there is the view of supremacy and purity, there is striving for that, and that leads to pride.

original: mchog tu lta ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu lta ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view of supremacy is the overesteeming of views.

original: dag par lta ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //üîΩde la zhes bya ba ni mchog dang dag par lta ba'i gzhi'o //üîΩmchog dang dag par lta ba'i gzhi de don du gnyer ba ni srid pa ste /
analyzed: dag par lta ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o // de la zhes bya ba ni mchog dang dag par lta ba'i gzhi'o // mchog dang dag par lta ba'i gzhi de don du gnyer ba ni srid pa ste /
translated: The view of purity is the overesteeming of morality and asceticism.üîΩThe basis of the view of purity is the basis of the view of purity and the highest.

original: gzhi de mchog nyid dag pa'i rgyu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi de mchog nyid dag pa'i rgyu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Craving for that is existence, because one manifestly desires that basis to be the cause of purity and the highest.

original: des kyang nga rgyal du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gang la mchog dang dag par lta ba yod pa des khengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kyang nga rgyal du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gang la mchog dang dag par lta ba yod pa des khengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, pride also occurs, because one who has the view of purity and the highest becomes inflated.

original: de'i phyir sred pa dang nga rgyal dag ni mi 'dod kyang kun tu 'gro ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sred pa dang nga rgyal dag ni mi 'dod kyang kun tu 'gro ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, craving and pride are omnipresent, even though they are not desired.

original: da ni srid pa dang nga rgyal gnyis kun tu 'gro ba nyid yin na spang pa mi srid par @122a * //
analyzed: da ni srid pa dang nga rgyal gnyis kun tu 'gro ba nyid yin na spang pa mi srid par @122a * //
translated: Now, if existence and pride are omnipresent, their abandonment is impossible.

original: bshad pa ni de ltar yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bshad pa ni de ltar yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: This is explained in the following: If that is so, then the abandonment of the afflictions is impossible.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa gang dang gang zhig mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa can de dang de dag ni de mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa gang dang gang zhig mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa can de dang de dag ni de mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Whatever objects such as attachment are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, they are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.üîΩThe remaining objects are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: lhag ma ni bsgom pas spang bar bya bdag yin zhing 'di gnyis ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dmigs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: lhag ma ni bsgom pas spang bar bya bdag yin zhing 'di gnyis ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dmigs pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since these two are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of meditation,

original: mtshan nyid 'di'i sgo nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur zhing bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di'i sgo nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur zhing bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: they are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing or the path of meditation from the perspective of their characteristics.

original: de'i phyir gnyis ka gang gis spang bar bya ba yin pa de brjod dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis ka gang gis spang bar bya ba yin pa de brjod dgos so zhe na /
translated: Therefore it must be said that they are objects to be abandoned by both.

original: de'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúThey are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.‚Äù

original: de nyid la rgyu ni 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu ni 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reason for that is because they focus on a mixture.

original: gang dang gang zhig mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa can zhes bya ba der ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'ba' zhig gis dmigs pa can mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang zhig mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa can zhes bya ba der ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'ba' zhig gis dmigs pa can mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúhaving the object to be abandoned by the path of seeing‚Äù is taught to be only that which is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: lhag ma ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin zhing zhes bya ba ni gang dag bsgom pa 'ba' zhig gis spang bar bya ba dang gnyis ka la dmigs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin zhing zhes bya ba ni gang dag bsgom pa 'ba' zhig gis spang bar bya ba dang gnyis ka la dmigs pa rnams so //
translated: The rest are to be abandoned by the path of meditation, meaning those that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation alone and those that focus on both.

original: de'i phyir 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i phyir 'dir gnyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid du mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i phyir 'dir gnyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid du mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, because they focus on a mixture, it is not contradictory that they are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: yang na lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas bcug pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas bcug pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, because they are engaged by the power of view,

original: lta ba'i stobs bskyed pa ni nus pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i stobs bskyed pa ni nus pa'o //
translated: the power of view is their ability.

original: gnyis po de la des bcug pa'i ngang tshul yod cing /
analyzed: gnyis po de la des bcug pa'i ngang tshul yod cing /
translated: They have the nature of being engaged by that.

original: de'i dngos po yin pa ni lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas bcug pa gnyis de de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po yin pa ni lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas bcug pa gnyis de de'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the two that are engaged by the power of view.

original: de bzhin du dag pa dang mchog gi stobs kyis de dag 'jug gi de dag la ma bltos pa dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dag pa dang mchog gi stobs kyis de dag 'jug gi de dag la ma bltos pa dag ni ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, they engage their objects by the power of purity and supremacy, but they are not independent of those.

original: 'di'i phyir yang dag pa dang mchog tu lta ba ltar de nyid kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang dag pa dang mchog tu lta ba ltar de nyid kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, like the views of reality and supremacy, they are objects abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
translated: Vaibhasikas say:

original: nyon mongs pa 'di nyid rang gi mtshan nyid pa yin cing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di nyid rang gi mtshan nyid pa yin cing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: These are afflicted states that are specific afflicted states.

original: gang la bdag tu lta ba yod pa de la bdag la sred pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gang la bdag tu lta ba yod pa de la bdag la sred pa yod mod kyi /
translated: If the view of the self exists, craving for the self exists.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But they are specific afflicted states because they are afflicted states by their specific characteristics.

original: de'i phyir @122b lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas 'jug cing 'di dag gis yul yongs su gcod pa nyid kyang 'jug par 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir @122b lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas 'jug cing 'di dag gis yul yongs su gcod pa nyid kyang 'jug par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore they engage their objects by the power of view and they are asserted to engage their objects by merely apprehending their objects.

original: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i yan lag gcig gis kyang sgyur bar byed rlom par byed rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i dbang nyid kyis sdug bsngal thob pa la sogs pa de'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i yan lag gcig gis kyang sgyur bar byed rlom par byed rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i dbang nyid kyis sdug bsngal thob pa la sogs pa de'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid de /
translated: So too, the eye and so on are the dominant condition that transforms, inflates, and engages the self, and the self obtains suffering and so on through the power of the eye and so on. Therefore they are objects abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'di ni kho bo cag gi'o zhes bya ba nyid de /üîΩgal te rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal thob pa la sogs pa nyid kho na yin na 'jig tshogs la lta bas rab tu bcug pa'i dge ba yang sdug bsngal thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni kho bo cag gi'o zhes bya ba nyid de / gal te rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal thob pa la sogs pa nyid kho na yin na 'jig tshogs la lta bas rab tu bcug pa'i dge ba yang sdug bsngal thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is our position.üîΩIf the self obtains suffering and so on through the power of engaging the self, then virtue engaged by the afflicted view of the self would also obtain suffering.

original: kun tu 'gro bas rab tu bcug pa dang khams dang ches nye ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa de yang mthong bas spang bar bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na 'di la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro bas rab tu bcug pa dang khams dang ches nye ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa de yang mthong bas spang bar bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na 'di la brjod par bya'o //
translated: And if the self obtains suffering and so on through the power of engaging the pervasive states and attachment to the realms and levels, then those pervasive states would also be objects abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: ci'i rgyus bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i ma rig par rang gi mtshan nyid kyi nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i rgyus bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i ma rig par rang gi mtshan nyid kyi nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin /
translated: Why is ignorance to be abandoned by the path of meditation and not by the path of seeing?

original: 'di ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos la dmigs pa ma yin te yul chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos la dmigs pa ma yin te yul chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not focus on phenomena to be abandoned by the path of seeing because its object is small.

original: 'di brjod par bya ste gal te 'jig tshogs la lta ba chos rnam pa lnga la dmigs pa yang sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pas mi spong ba de lta na /üîΩ'dod chags dang khong khro dang nga rgyal rnams chos rnam pa lnga la dmigs pa yang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'di brjod par bya ste gal te 'jig tshogs la lta ba chos rnam pa lnga la dmigs pa yang sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pas mi spong ba de lta na / 'dod chags dang khong khro dang nga rgyal rnams chos rnam pa lnga la dmigs pa yang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: This should be stated: If the afflicted view of the self that focuses on the five types of phenomena is not abandoned by the path of seeing that realizes the four truths, thenüîΩattachment, anger and pride that focus on the five types of phenomena would not be abandoned by the path of seeing that realizes the four truths.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba spang 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin rnam pa lnga nyid du mi nus par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba spang 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin rnam pa lnga nyid du mi nus par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But it is not possible that the afflicted view of the self is not abandoned by the path of seeing that realizes the four truths, like attachment and so on.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba skad cig gis kyang tshor ba rnam pa lnga bdag gi bar 'dzin te rnam par shes pa'i bar yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba skad cig gis kyang tshor ba rnam pa lnga bdag gi bar 'dzin te rnam par shes pa'i bar yang de bzhin no //
translated: The afflicted view of the self also grasps the five aggregates as the self in a single moment, up to and including consciousness.

original: skad cig ma gcig la rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical to say that the five aggregates are grasped as the self in a single moment.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa skad cig ma gcig la dmigs pa gnyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa skad cig ma gcig la dmigs pa gnyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For it is not the case that attachment and so on have two objects in a single moment.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshungs pa ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ji ltar lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la 'gog pa dang lam la log par zhugs pas log par zhugs pa'i phyir 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin pa de lta na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag rang gi mtshan nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshungs pa ma yin no // 'o na ji ltar lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la 'gog pa dang lam la log par zhugs pas log par zhugs pa'i phyir 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin pa de lta na /
translated: Therefore it is not similar to say that these are afflictions by their own characteristics.üîΩIf that is so, then why is it that the overesteeming of morality and asceticism is to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path, since it wrongly engages cessation and path?

original: de lta ba yang 'gog pa dang lam @123a * //
analyzed: de lta ba yang 'gog pa dang lam @123a * //
translated: It is not that the overesteeming of morality and asceticism is to be abandoned by seeing cessation and path,

original: la log par zhugs pas log par zhugs pa'i phyir 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya'o zhes ci'i phyir brtag par mi bya /üîΩji ltar dmigs pa yongs su shes pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong bar dmigs pa spangs pa de bzhin du 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kyang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dag tu ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: la log par zhugs pas log par zhugs pa'i phyir 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya'o zhes ci'i phyir brtag par mi bya / ji ltar dmigs pa yongs su shes pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong bar dmigs pa spangs pa de bzhin du 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kyang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dag tu ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: Why not investigate whether they are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path because they wrongly engage their objects and wrongly engage those who wrongly engage them?üîΩJust as the afflicted view of the self is abandoned by abandoning its focal object, so too, why not assert that objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path are abandoned by abandoning the focal object of the afflicted view of the self?

original: ji ltar 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la dmigs pa spangs pa las spangs pa de bzhin du 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa dag 'jig tshogs la ltaüîΩbar ci ste mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la dmigs pa spangs pa las spangs pa de bzhin du 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa dag 'jig tshogs la ltaüîΩbar ci ste mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Just as objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path are abandoned by abandoning the focal object of clinging to those views as supreme, so too, why not assert that objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path are abandoned by abandoning objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of the self?

original: 'di dag kyang mtshungs pa ma yin pa gang gi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi phan yon dang nyes dmigs mthong nas de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin no //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang mtshungs pa ma yin pa gang gi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi phan yon dang nyes dmigs mthong nas de'i bdag nyid du 'dzin no //
translated: But they are not similar, because one grasps the self of the view of the transitory collection as the benefit and disadvantage of seeing cessation and the path.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa dang dmigs pa yongs su mi gcod kyang de'i nyes pa dang phan yon mthong bas yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa dang dmigs pa yongs su mi gcod kyang de'i nyes pa dang phan yon mthong bas yongs su gcod do //
translated: Although one does not completely eliminate the view grasping the supreme and its focal object, one completely eliminates it by seeing its faults and benefits.

original: gang yang dmigs pa yongs su shes pa kho nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba mtha' dag spong gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang dmigs pa yongs su shes pa kho nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba mtha' dag spong gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Also, one abandons the entire view of the transitory collection by merely comprehending its focal object, but one does not abandon the view grasping the supreme.

original: de la rgyu yod pa gang yin pa de 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya bal dmigs te /
analyzed: de la rgyu yod pa gang yin pa de 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya bal dmigs te /
translated: That which has a cause is the object of abandonment by seeing the truth of cessation.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin ba ni rnam pa dang bcas pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin ba ni rnam pa dang bcas pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the view grasping the supreme is to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, origin and cessation, together with their aspects.

original: de la gang 'bras bu'i ngo bos 'du byed mchog go zhes mngon par zhen pa de ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya'o //üîΩrgyu'i ngo bos ni kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang 'bras bu'i ngo bos 'du byed mchog go zhes mngon par zhen pa de ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya'o // rgyu'i ngo bos ni kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
translated: Those who are attached to the idea that the supreme form of formative factors is the nature of the result should be made to abandon this by means of the vision of suffering.üîΩThose who are attached to the idea that the supreme form of formative factors is the cause should be made to abandon this by means of the vision of origination.

original: gang zhig de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa de ni 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i rnam pa de ni 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
translated: Those who are attached to the idea that the supreme form of formative factors is the path should be made to abandon this by means of the vision of cessation.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba bzhin spangs pa ni med par sgrub po //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba bzhin spangs pa ni med par sgrub po //
translated: The abandonment of the latter is not established in the same way as the abandonment of the view of the transitory collection.

original: de bzhin du lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par zhugs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par zhugs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should state that the wrong engagement that is to be abandoned by means of the vision of the path is also not established in the same way as the abandonment of the view of the transitory collection.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang khyad med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang khyad med do //
translated: The wrong engagement that is to be abandoned by means of the vision of suffering and origination is not different from the overesteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: kha cig ni gnyi ga yang zag pa bcas pa thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir dang mchog gi rnam pas zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni gnyi ga yang zag pa bcas pa thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir dang mchog gi rnam pas zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Both are stated in this way because they focus on all that is contaminated and because they engage in the aspect of the supreme.

original: @123b bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: @123b bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say:

original: khyad par yod de /
analyzed: khyad par yod de /
translated: There is a difference.

original: gang zhig 'jig tshogs la rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag tu lta bas mchog tu mthong ba de ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig tshogs la rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag tu lta bas mchog tu mthong ba de ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: That which is seen as supreme by the view of the transitory collection that views it as permanent, blissful, and a self is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: 'di yang srid kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes lta zhing mchog tu mthong ba de ni kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o zhes zer ro //üîΩrnam par smin pa'i sgo nas 'du byed 'thor ba rnams la mchog tu lta ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang srid kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes lta zhing mchog tu mthong ba de ni kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o zhes zer ro // rnam par smin pa'i sgo nas 'du byed 'thor ba rnams la mchog tu lta ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: That which is seen as supreme by the view that this is not the cause of existence is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.üîΩThat which is seen as supreme by the view that the scattered formations that are the result of karma are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.üîΩThat which is seen as supreme by the view that the scattered formations that are the cause of karma and affliction are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas 'thor ba ni kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ste spros pas chog go / bstan bcos la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas 'thor ba ni kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ste spros pas chog go / bstan bcos la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Enough with this elaboration.üîΩThe treatise engages in this topic:üîΩThose that pervade the entire realm of homogeneity

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba dag tu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba dag tu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: are called pervasive.

original: 'dir skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba zhes khyad par du byas pas skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba dag kyang yod do zhes khas blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba zhes khyad par du byas pas skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba dag kyang yod do zhes khas blangs pa yin la /
translated: Since the phrase ‚Äúpervading the same realm‚Äù is specified here, it is understood that there are also those that pervade different realms.

original: de dag kyang ci 'di dag las gang zhig yin nam 'on te gzhan yin zhes mi shes pa de'i phyir de dag las dgu gong du dmigs zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dag kyang ci 'di dag las gang zhig yin nam 'on te gzhan yin zhes mi shes pa de'i phyir de dag las dgu gong du dmigs zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since it is not known whether they are the same as those or different, it says, ‚ÄúNine focus on higher realms.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang dgu po gang yin pa mi shes pas de'i phyir lta ba gnyis po ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos so ;üîΩ/ res 'ga' ni gzugs kyi khams sam gzugs med pa'i khams kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang dgu po gang yin pa mi shes pas de'i phyir lta ba gnyis po ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos so ; / res 'ga' ni gzugs kyi khams sam gzugs med pa'i khams kyang rung ste /
translated: Since it is still not known which nine, it says, ‚ÄúExcept for the two views.‚Äù

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i khams gcig la dmigs so //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i khams gcig la dmigs so //
translated: Sometimes they focus on one realm of the same realm, either the form realm or the formless realm.

original: res 'ga' ni gnyis la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gnyis la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Sometimes they focus on two,

original: gnyis ka la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis ka la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which means they focus on both.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i log par lta ba ni don gyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la skur pa 'debs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i log par lta ba ni don gyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la skur pa 'debs la /
translated: Thus, wrong view in the desire realm in fact denies the suffering of the form and formless realms.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pas kyang mchog tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pas kyang mchog tu 'dzin to //
translated: Also, holding view to be paramount holds that view to be supreme.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas kyang rgyu ma yin pa de rgyur 'dzin to //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas kyang rgyu ma yin pa de rgyur 'dzin to //
translated: Also, holding ethics and vows to be paramount holds that which is not a cause to be a cause.

original: the tshom gyis ni som nyi za la /
analyzed: the tshom gyis ni som nyi za la /
translated: Doubt is indecision.

original: ma rig pa rmongs te /
analyzed: ma rig pa rmongs te /
translated: Ignorance is confusion.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kyang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kyang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: So too, those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin should be understood in the appropriate way.

original: gzugs na spyod pa dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag ni yul dang sa'i sgo nas gzhag par bya ba la /üîΩ'di ni nges pa yin te 'dod pa'i khams nas bsam @124a * //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag ni yul dang sa'i sgo nas gzhag par bya ba la / 'di ni nges pa yin te 'dod pa'i khams nas bsam @124a * //
translated: The form and formless realms are posited from the perspective of object and level.

original: gtan bzhi pa'i bar na ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: gtan bzhi pa'i bar na ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba yod do //
translated: This is definite: from the desire realm up to the fourth absorption, there are those that pervade different realms.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams na ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sa kun tu 'gro ba rnams yod do //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams na ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sa kun tu 'gro ba rnams yod do //
translated: The remaining levels, with the exception of the summit of existence, have the omnipresent negative tendencies of the dissimilar realms.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo na ni gnyi ga yang med de khams dang sa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams re re dang / sdom pa de dag gi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la bstan bcos khungs su smras pa ni /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo na ni gnyi ga yang med de khams dang sa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro // gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams re re dang / sdom pa de dag gi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la bstan bcos khungs su smras pa ni /
translated: Neither exist on the summit of existence because there is no other realm or level above it.üîΩThe treatise attainment of knowledge states:

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Those possessing the desire realm, those possessing the form realm and those possessing the formless realm.üîΩUnable to tolerate that the afflicted views of theüîΩperpetuity of the self and theüîΩextremes are omnipresent negative tendencies of the dissimilar realms, he says:üîΩWhen abiding in the desire realm, one possesses the two views of the

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba nyid yin pa ma bzod nas gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba nyid yin pa ma bzod nas gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: perpetuity of the self and the extremes.

original: bdag dang bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because one does not grasp the self and mine.

original: sa dang khams gzhan du skyes pa la ni sa dang khams gzhan gyi phung po dag go snyam pa'i lta ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: sa dang khams gzhan du skyes pa la ni sa dang khams gzhan gyi phung po dag go snyam pa'i lta ba mi 'thad de /
translated: But it is not tenable that one born in another realm or in another level would have the view that the aggregates of another realm or level are the self,

original: lus gnyis khas blangs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus gnyis khas blangs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to accept two bodies.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa yod na bdag gir 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag gir lta ba yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa yod na bdag gir 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag gir lta ba yang mi 'thad do //
translated: And it is not tenable that the view of mine would be the object of the view of the transitory collection, because if the view of the self exists, the view of mine would also exist.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang de'i yul can du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang de'i yul can du mi rung ngo //
translated: And it is not tenable that the view of the transitory collection would be the object of the view holding to an extreme, because the view of the transitory collection is concomitant with the view holding to an extreme.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: sred pas stobs bskyed pa'i phyir dang mtha' dang nye ba'i srid pa bdag gir byas pa'i phyir dang mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sred pas stobs bskyed pa'i phyir dang mtha' dang nye ba'i srid pa bdag gir byas pa'i phyir dang mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The view of the transitory collection does not focus on the realms of different realms because it is generated by craving, because it appropriates the end and the near end of existence, and because it is the object of direct perception.

original: 'o na 'di lta ba gang zhig yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na 'di lta ba gang zhig yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: What view is this?

original: gal te phung po dag la bdag gi rnam pa dang rtag pa'i rnam par zhugs kyang /
analyzed: gal te phung po dag la bdag gi rnam pa dang rtag pa'i rnam par zhugs kyang /
translated: If the self were to enter into the aggregates in the aspect of ‚Äúmine‚Äù and in the aspect of permanence,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ma yin na /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ma yin na /
translated: then it would not be the afflicted view of the self or the extreme view.

original: 'o na 'di lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: What view is it?

original: gzhan nyid du srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid du srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible that they are different,

original: de'i phyir rnam pa tha dad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //üîΩ'di ni lta ba ma yin gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa tha dad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o // 'di ni lta ba ma yin gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: because they enter into different aspects.üîΩThis is not a view, etc.üîΩThis is a wrong consciousness that is induced by the afflicted view of the self, but it is not a view.üîΩBecause it is a wrong consciousness, it is not a view.

original: 'di ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas rab tu bcug pa'i log pa'i shes pa yin gyi lta ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas rab tu bcug pa'i log pa'i shes pa yin gyi lta ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is a wrong consciousness because it is a consciousness that is in error with regard to its object.üîΩIt is in error because it is not in accordance with the object.üîΩIt is not in accordance with the object because it is in error with regard to the object.üîΩIt is in error with regard to the object because it is in error with regard to the self.

original: de dag dang 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: thob pa rnams ni phra rgyas dang lhan cig mi 'byung ste 'bras bu du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: mu bzhi pa ni de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / chos gzhan rnams te kun tu 'gro ba'i phra rgyas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / chos gzhan rnams te kun tu 'gro ba'i phra rgyas kyang ma yin la /
translated: The fourth possibility is future negative tendencies that arise simultaneously with those and other phenomena. They are neither pervasive negative tendencies nor

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: are they causes by the cause of being pervasive.

translated: Thus, since they are eighteen in number, they are the eighteen elements and the elements that focus on uncontaminated states.

original: ni mi shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ni mi shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Some say: Since ignorance is the nature of non-knowledge, it does not focus on an object,

original: long ba bzhin du mthong ba bcom pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: long ba bzhin du mthong ba bcom pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because it engages like a blind person who destroys what is seen.

original: mi shes pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: Non-knowledge is not suitable to have an object.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis ma rig pa sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis ma rig pa sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with the mind, like feeling, etc.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not associated with the mind, like feeling, etc.

original: de lta yin na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi 'thad par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi 'thad par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were, then it would follow, absurdly, that the mind and mental factors would be untenable,

original: rtag tu rgyud la gnas pa'i phyir dang de dang 'jug pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyud la gnas pa'i phyir dang de dang 'jug pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would always be present in the mental continuum and because it would be contradictory for them to engage in it.

original: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'am 'du shes med par gyur pa yang kun tu rmongs pas dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'am 'du shes med par gyur pa yang kun tu rmongs pas dmigs pa med do //
translated: Also, when one is in a mindless meditative absorption or in a state of nondiscernment, there is no object of ignorance.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i sgrib pa'i 'jug pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul phyi rol gyi mun pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i sgrib pa'i 'jug pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul phyi rol gyi mun pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The engagement of the obscurations of the mind and mental factors is not the external darkness that is the object of the eye consciousness.

original: de smos pas mthong ba nye bar bcom par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de smos pas mthong ba nye bar bcom par gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, by mentioning it, the destruction of seeing is implied.

original: ma rig pa yang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa mthong ba'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa yang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa mthong ba'i rgyu byed do //
translated: Also, ignorance is the cause of seeing the truths of suffering and so on.

original: bdag med pa mthong bar gyur pa de'i phyir 'di ni mthong ba nye bar 'joms par byed pa shes pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong bar gyur pa de'i phyir 'di ni mthong ba nye bar 'joms par byed pa shes pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Because of the vision of selflessness, this ignorance does not accompany the knowledge that destroys the object of the view of self.

original: gnyid kyis log pa las yul 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa las yul 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When one is asleep, there is no apprehension of objects.

original: dmigs pa'i rgyu 'jug par byed pa la sems blun pa nyid du gyur pa de bzhin du ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rgyu 'jug par byed pa la sems blun pa nyid du gyur pa de bzhin du ma rig pa ste /
translated: Just as the cause of the apprehension of objects is the mind that is deluded about the cause of the object, in the same way, ignorance is the cause of the apprehension of objects.

original: 'di dmigs pa dang bcas pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di dmigs pa dang bcas pa la'o //
translated: This is the case when there is an object.

original: 'on te ci'i phyir 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ma 'dris pa'i ma rig pa med ce na /
analyzed: 'on te ci'i phyir 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ma 'dris pa'i ma rig pa med ce na /
translated: Why is there no non-associated ignorance to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path?

original: de ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos la dmigs pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong ba nyid kyis spangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos la dmigs pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong ba nyid kyis spangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the objects of the truths of cessation and path are pure, and because the objects of the truths of cessation and path are not to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: rnam pa brgyad po de ni gnyen por gyur pa'i rtogs pa nyid yin pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad po de ni gnyen por gyur pa'i rtogs pa nyid yin pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the eight aspects are the realization that is the antidote, there is no other object of the path of seeing to be abandoned.

original: phra rgyas ma 'dres pa gzhan gyi ni /
analyzed: phra rgyas ma 'dres pa gzhan gyi ni /
translated: Other negative tendencies are not mixed.üîΩ

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mngon par rtogs pa nyid gnyen po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mngon par rtogs pa nyid gnyen po la sogs pa ste /
translated: The other negative tendencies that are not mixed with the negative tendencies of the realms are abandoned by the antidotes of the paths of seeing of the truths of suffering and origin.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong ba nyid kyis spong bar byed kyi 'gog pa dang lam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong ba nyid kyis spong bar byed kyi 'gog pa dang lam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: They are abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin alone, not by seeing the truths of cessation and path.

original: dper na lta @125b ba mchog tu 'dzin pa sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu'i sgo nas bde ba dang gtsang ba'i rnam pas zhugs te thams cad 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs kyang sdug bsngal mthong ba kho nas spong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lta @125b ba mchog tu 'dzin pa sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu'i sgo nas bde ba dang gtsang ba'i rnam pas zhugs te thams cad 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs kyang sdug bsngal mthong ba kho nas spong ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the overesteeming of morality and asceticism is engaged through the aspects of pleasure and purity, but it is abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering alone, even though it focuses on objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path.

original: 'bras bu la log par sgrub ba'i gnyen po mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu la log par sgrub ba'i gnyen po mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the wrong practice of the result manifests.üîΩIsn't this like the overesteeming of morality and asceticism?

original: 'di lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa bzhin 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa bzhin 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'di ma rig pa'i phra rgyas la sgrub pa'i rnam pa tsam yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ma rig pa'i phra rgyas la sgrub pa'i rnam pa tsam yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa tha dad pa med do //
translated: Because it is merely the establishment of the negative tendencies of ignorance, it does not have a different engagement.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes rnams la rnam pa mang du log par zhugs pas de la sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams la sdug bsngal

translated: The view grasping an extreme is the yoga of directly realizing suffering that wrongly engages many aspects of contaminated discernment.

original: dang mi gtsang bar lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang mi gtsang bar lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Yogis and yoginis abandon objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path by viewing them as suffering and as impure.

original: de'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i bden pa gnyis po 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba lta bas mchog tu 'dzin pa ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa'i phra rgyas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa la yod pa de ni sgrub pa tsam nyid
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i bden pa gnyis po 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba lta bas mchog tu 'dzin pa ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa'i phra rgyas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa la yod pa de ni sgrub pa tsam nyid
translated: Therefore, the subtle proliferators of ignorance that are not mixed with the view grasping an extreme that is directly realized by seeing the truths of cessation and path are objects abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: kyi sgo nas phan tshun khyad par du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: kyi sgo nas phan tshun khyad par du gyur pa yin no //

translated: Here it should be extensively proven that they are antidotes because they are of the same type, they mutually focus on each other and they are the cause.

original: de'i phyir phan tshun rgyu can dang phan tshun dmigs pa gnyen po'i rigs can te lam dmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis phra rgyas dmigs pas na 'chol ba'i skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun rgyu can dang phan tshun dmigs pa gnyen po'i rigs can te lam dmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis phra rgyas dmigs pas na 'chol ba'i skyon med do //
translated: Therefore there is no fault of confusion because the path that is the antidote of the same type and that focuses on the object to be abandoned is the cause of each other and they mutually focus on each other.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'dod par gtogs pa'i log par lta ba sa dgu'i sdug bsngal la dmigs she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'dod par gtogs pa'i log par lta ba sa dgu'i sdug bsngal la dmigs she na /
translated: Why does wrong view belonging to the desire realm focus on the suffering of the nine levels?

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar sa brgyad dang rang gi sa kho na'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang sa dgu'i log par lta ba rang gi sa pa'i 'du byed rnams 'gog pa la dmigs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar sa brgyad dang rang gi sa kho na'i 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang sa dgu'i log par lta ba rang gi sa pa'i 'du byed rnams 'gog pa la dmigs so //
translated: The cessation of the first absorption is seen by the path of seeing of the desire realm and so on up to the cessation of the summit of existence is seen by the path of seeing of the base of nothingness.

original: 'dir rgyu yod pas rgyu dang 'bras bu yongs su bcad de rang gi sa dang khams rnams su sa dgu'i sdug bsngal phan tshun 'dren pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu yod pas rgyu dang 'bras bu yongs su bcad de rang gi sa dang khams rnams su sa dgu'i sdug bsngal phan tshun 'dren pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, since the cause exists, cause and effect are ascertained and the cessation of the nine levels is mutually induced in their own levels and realms.

original: skyed pa dang gnas pa dad brten pa'i rgyu rnams kyis phan tshun rgyu can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyed pa dang gnas pa dad brten pa'i rgyu rnams kyis phan tshun rgyu can ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not mutually induced by the causes that generate and maintain them.

original: 'di ltar phan tshun 'dren pas 'gog pa dang phan tshun rgyu can no zhes rnam par rto ga 'di 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar phan tshun 'dren pas 'gog pa dang phan tshun rgyu can no zhes rnam par rto ga 'di 'thad do //
translated: Thus it is tenable to think that cessation is mutually induced and mutually caused.

original: yang 'du byed gang dag la bdag tu lta bas bdag tu bltas te 'jug pa de rnams la mngon par dga' ba dang nye bar gnas pa ni de'i sa pa'i log par lta bas 'di dag la 'gog pa med do zhes skur pa 'debs so //
analyzed: yang 'du byed gang dag la bdag tu lta bas bdag tu bltas te 'jug pa de rnams la mngon par dga' ba dang nye bar gnas pa ni de'i sa pa'i log par lta bas 'di dag la 'gog pa med do zhes skur pa 'debs so //
translated: Also, one who engages in the view of the self with regard to any compounded phenomena that are viewed as the self, and who delights in and abides in them, denigrates them with the wrong view of that level, saying, ‚ÄúThere is no cessation of these.‚ÄùüîΩ Attachment is to be abandoned

original: 'dod chags ni spang bar bya ba yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩ'dod chags ni thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyi gcig tu spang bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni spang bar bya ba yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / 'dod chags ni thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyi gcig tu spang bar bya ba yin na /
translated: If attachment were to focus on the uncontaminated,üîΩit would not be abandoned by those who seek liberation.

original: de gal te zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin na ni thar pa 'dod par zhugs pa'i phyir dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gal te zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin na ni thar pa 'dod par zhugs pa'i phyir dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If attachment were to focus on the uncontaminated, it would not be abandoned by yogins and yoginis, because they seek liberation.

original: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi gzhi ni spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zad pa med pa yang spang bar bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi gzhi ni spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zad pa med pa yang spang bar bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the basis of aspiration and attachment would be abandoned, because the uncontaminated would be the object of abandonment.

original: 'dod chags kyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be the focal object of attachment.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spangs na de lta na khyed kyi gzugs de spang bar 'gyur ro @128a * //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spangs na de lta na khyed kyi gzugs de spang bar 'gyur ro @128a * // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has said: ‚ÄúIf you abandon craving for desire, then your form will be abandoned.

original: 'gog pa dang lam dag la yang skyon gyi sgo nas blta bar bya ba dag go zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam dag la yang skyon gyi sgo nas blta bar bya ba dag go zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that you should also view cessation and the path as faults.

original: ci'i phyir yul gyi skyon mthong ba las ni sred pa dang bral bar 'gyur la gzhan du ma yin zhe na /üîΩzhi ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa rnams kyi sa zag pa med pa'i chos la lta ba'i sgo nas de la dmigs pa'i sred pa 'phel ba nyid du 'gyur gyi spong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir yul gyi skyon mthong ba las ni sred pa dang bral bar 'gyur la gzhan du ma yin zhe na / zhi ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa rnams kyi sa zag pa med pa'i chos la lta ba'i sgo nas de la dmigs pa'i sred pa 'phel ba nyid du 'gyur gyi spong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Why does one become free from craving through seeing the faults of the object, but not otherwise?üîΩCraving increases through viewing uncontaminated states, such as the aspects of peace, but it is not abandoned.

original: sred pas yul la yon tan du mthong bas sred pa 'phel bar mthong ba de'i phyir zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags med do ;
analyzed: sred pas yul la yon tan du mthong bas sred pa 'phel bar mthong ba de'i phyir zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags med do ;
translated: Craving increases through seeing the qualities of objects due to craving, but craving does not increase through seeing uncontaminated states.

original: /'gog pa dang lam dag ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa'i rgyu mtshan dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: /'gog pa dang lam dag ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa'i rgyu mtshan dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Cessation and the path are not like that, because they are free from the sign of the cause of harm.

original: 'di dag gi nyon mongs pa ma rig la zag pa med pa'i ni mchog tu phra ba zhes bya ba ni de la de'i 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi nyon mongs pa ma rig la zag pa med pa'i ni mchog tu phra ba zhes bya ba ni de la de'i 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The afflictions of these are ignorance, but the uncontaminated is called supreme subtlety, because its engagement does not exist there.

original: nga rgyal yang khengs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ma zhi ba yin na /
analyzed: nga rgyal yang khengs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ma zhi ba yin na /
translated: Also, pride is characterized by haughtiness, so it is not peace.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni rab tu zhi ba yin pa'i phyir des khengs par 'gyur bar mi 'os so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni rab tu zhi ba yin pa'i phyir des khengs par 'gyur bar mi 'os so //
translated: Since uncontaminated phenomena are peace, it is not appropriate that it be inflated by that.

original: bdag gis ni chos de dag 'thob po snyam du de ltar nga rgyal skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: bdag gis ni chos de dag 'thob po snyam du de ltar nga rgyal skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: If pride arises thinking, I have attained those phenomena,

original: zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rkyen gyi de skye bar rig pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rkyen gyi de skye bar rig pa ma yin te ;
translated: it is not known that it arises due to the condition of uncontaminated phenomena.

original: de dag ni de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang yang dag pa'i don du dag pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag ni de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang yang dag pa'i don du dag pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are its antidote and because they are pure in the ultimate sense.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis zhugs pa'i phyir de dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis zhugs pa'i phyir de dang mthun pa ste /
translated: Because they are engaged in the meaning that is not erroneous, they are in accordance with that.

original: 'di dam bcas pa dang 'gal ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di dam bcas pa dang 'gal ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that they are not in contradiction with the thesis.

original: de dag ni mchog kyang yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni mchog kyang yin te /
translated: They are also supreme,

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang dge ba dang rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang dge ba dang rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the antidote to the afflictions, because they are virtuous and permanent, and because they are uncontaminated.

original: dngos po dman pa zag pa dang bcas pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po dman pa zag pa dang bcas pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: The view that holds inferior things to be supreme is the overesteeming of inferior views.

original: gzhan yang gal te mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis pa zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis pa zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the second overesteeming has an uncontaminated object, it would have the characteristic of right view,

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni dag pa yin pa'i phyir dang mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni dag pa yin pa'i phyir dang mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag tu yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would not be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de lta bu ni 'o na gang dag 'gog pa la @128b skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba la zhe sdang ba de 'gog pa dang mthun pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu ni 'o na gang dag 'gog pa la @128b skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba la zhe sdang ba de 'gog pa dang mthun pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /

analyzed: 'di la 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid med de /

original: ris la sred pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag kyang lung du ma bstan par thal bar 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: ris la sred pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag kyang lung du ma bstan par thal bar 'gyur ba la /
translated: It would follow that craving for higher rebirth and pride thinking i would also be indeterminate.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re thal bar 'gyur ba med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re thal bar 'gyur ba med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says that it is not correct to draw that conclusion.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i dbang gis mtho ris su skye ba don du gnyer ba 'thad pa'i phyir der bdag bde ba la longs spyad par bya'o snyam du de'i sgo nas bsod nams mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i dbang gis mtho ris su skye ba don du gnyer ba 'thad pa'i phyir der bdag bde ba la longs spyad par bya'o snyam du de'i sgo nas bsod nams mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: It is tenable that one who seeks higher rebirth through the power of the view of the self engages in the meritorious action of accumulating merit thinking, I will enjoy happiness there.

original: 'dod chags kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa la stobs dang ldan pa'i rgyur gsungs pas 'di mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa la stobs dang ldan pa'i rgyur gsungs pas 'di mi dge ba'o //

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rjes su kun tu spyod pa'i sems mtho bas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i bya ba dang mthun pa ma yin te dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa la mi brtson pa'i phyir bdag tu nga rgyal can
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rjes su kun tu spyod pa'i sems mtho bas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i bya ba dang mthun pa ma yin te dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa la mi brtson pa'i phyir bdag tu nga rgyal can
translated: Those who are proud of their self

original: rnams kyis skyes bu dam pa bsten pa la sogs pa rnyed dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: rnams kyis skyes bu dam pa bsten pa la sogs pa rnyed dka' ba yin no //
translated: do not strive to rely on a spiritual master.

original: 'dir sbyin pa la sogs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bzhin mtho ris la sred pa lung ma bstan nyid du bshad pa 'di'i lan du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir sbyin pa la sogs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bzhin mtho ris la sred pa lung ma bstan nyid du bshad pa 'di'i lan du sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is craving for the higher realms explained as neutral, like the view of the perishing aggregates, because it is not incompatible with generosity and so on?‚Äù is applied.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang gis de skyed pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang gis de skyed pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not neutral because it is generated by the power of the view of the perishing aggregates.

original: gal te 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang gis gang bskyed pa de lung du ma bstan pa ma yin pa de lta na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang gis gang bskyed pa de lung du ma bstan pa ma yin pa de lta na /
translated: If what is generated by the power of the view of the perishing aggregates is not neutral,üîΩthen

analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang lung du ma bstan pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, extreme view would not be neutral.üîΩIt is not that craving for higher rebirth is known to be the cause that severs the root of virtue.

original: mtho ris la sred pa dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa'i rgyur rig pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba de bzhin du nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang rang gi rdzas la rmongs pa'i phyir dang gzhan la gnod pas 'jug pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba
analyzed: mtho ris la sred pa dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa'i rgyur rig pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba de bzhin du nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang rang gi rdzas la rmongs pa'i phyir dang gzhan la gnod pas 'jug pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba
translated: Similarly, pride thinking i is explained to be neutral because it is ignorance about one's own substance and because it engages in harming others, like the afflicted view of the self.

original: bzhin lung du ma bstan pa yin par bshad pa phyogs snga ma'i lan du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bzhin lung du ma bstan pa yin par bshad pa phyogs snga ma'i lan du sbyar ro //
translated: This is the response to the opponent's position.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rjes su kun tu spyod pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa ma yin zhing sems mtho bar 'jug pa yang dag pa'i bshes gnyen bsten pa la mi brtson pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rjes su kun tu spyod pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa ma yin zhing sems mtho bar 'jug pa yang dag pa'i bshes gnyen bsten pa la mi brtson pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yin na /
translated: It is not neutral because it is concomitant with the afflicted view of the self and it is neutral because it does not strive to rely on a true spiritual friend, since it engages the mind in a lofty manner.

original: de lta na 'o na rang gi rdzas la kun tu rmongs pa dang gzhan la gnod par zhugs pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa nyid rgyu gcig ma yin pas 'jig tshogs @131b la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang nyon mongs pa gzhan dang chos
analyzed: de lta na 'o na rang gi rdzas la kun tu rmongs pa dang gzhan la gnod par zhugs pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa nyid rgyu gcig ma yin pas 'jig tshogs @131b la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang nyon mongs pa gzhan dang chos
translated: If that is so, then since it is confused about its own substance and engages in harming others, it is not a single cause of being neutral.

original: mtshungs pas mi dge ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pas mi dge ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the afflicted view of the self and extreme view are similar to other afflictions, they would be nonvirtuous.

original: ri dags dang bya rnams la yang yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni bab chol du sgra thos pas skrag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ri dags dang bya rnams la yang yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni bab chol du sgra thos pas skrag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: That which exists for animals and birds is like the cause of fear from hearing a sound by mistake.

original: rnam par brtags pa ni mi dge ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba ste dper na mu stegs can rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa ni mi dge ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba ste dper na mu stegs can rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: That which is imagined is nonvirtuous is that preceded by the conception of knowledge, for example, like the views of tƒ´rthikas.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di yang mi 'thad de rnam par ma brtags pa'i don ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di yang mi 'thad de rnam par ma brtags pa'i don ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that this is also untenable because it is untenable that the meaning of nonimagination is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung ma bstan du 'gyur te ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung ma bstan du 'gyur te ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It would be non-defiled indeterminate, because of the absurdity of the consequence.

original: ri dags dang bya la sogs pa rnams la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ri dags dang bya la sogs pa rnams la sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Deer, birds, etc. do not have the conceptualization of the beginning, etc.

original: the tshom yang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: the tshom yang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Doubt also would be twofold.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyang rnam par brtags pa'i don las mi dge ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba 'di bzlog zin to //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyang rnam par brtags pa'i don las mi dge ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba 'di bzlog zin to //
translated: The consequence that those in the form and formless realms would be unwholesome due to the object of conceptualization has already been refuted.

original: lhag ma rnams 'dir mi dge ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams 'dir mi dge ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The rest are unwholesome here.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba smos pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lhag ma bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba smos pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lhag ma bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúhere‚Äù is used to include the rest that occur in the desire realm.

original: 'dod chags thams cad dang zhe sdang thams cad smos pa ni rnam pa lnga ste nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags thams cad dang zhe sdang thams cad smos pa ni rnam pa lnga ste nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúall attachment‚Äù and ‚Äúall aversion‚Äù are used to include the five types.

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa ni kun 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i rtsa bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir gang zhig mi dge ba yang yin la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa ni kun 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba'i rtsa bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir gang zhig mi dge ba yang yin la /
translated: Ignorance that is concomitant with the afflicted view of the self and the extreme views is a root of cyclic existence because it is a root of cyclic existence.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚ÄúThose that are nonvirtuous and are also roots of nonvirtue.‚Äù

original: gal te mi dge ba sngar skyes pa thams cad phyi ma'i rgyu ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mi dge ba sngar skyes pa thams cad phyi ma'i rgyu ma yin nam /
translated: Are not all previously arisen nonvirtuous entities the causes of later nonvirtuous entities?

original: ma yin te 'di gsum kho nar rung ba med do //
analyzed: ma yin te 'di gsum kho nar rung ba med do //
translated: No, because these three alone are suitable to be roots.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are established as antidotes to the roots of virtue.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: nga rgyal med pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gnas skabs tha dad de /
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gnas skabs tha dad de /

original: skyob pa bcom ldan 'das kyi chos rnams su rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dge ba der rag las pa med pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skyob pa bcom ldan 'das kyi chos rnams su rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dge ba der rag las pa med pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
translated: Because the five virtuous collections of consciousness are not dependent on those roots of virtue in the Dharma of the Blessed One, the Protector.

original: du ni lung du bstan pa'i rtsa ba dag yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: du ni lung du bstan pa'i rtsa ba dag yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How many are roots of the revealed?

original: du ni phra rgyas lung @132a * //
analyzed: du ni phra rgyas lung @132a * //
translated: How many are roots of the negative influences?

original: du ma bstan pa rnams kyi rtsa ba dag yin du ni ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: du ma bstan pa rnams kyi rtsa ba dag yin du ni ma yin zhes bya'o //
