original: sred pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yod pa thams cad dang / 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //

translated: Ignorance is that which exists in the form and formless realms, and that which is associated with the afflicted view of the self and the extreme in the desire realm.üîΩEven that which is born from the cause of maturation, etc.

original: tha na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams na nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / sprul pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tha na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams na nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / sprul pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: means that in the form realm, it is associated with all the afflictions, with the mind born from the cause of maturation, with the mind of deportment, and with the mind of emanation.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: In the formless realm, it is concomitant with all the afflictions and with the mind that is the result of retribution.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i bdag nyid dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas dang / sprul pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i bdag nyid dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas dang / sprul pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: In the desire realm, it is concomitant with the mind that is the result of retribution, the mind that is the basis of deportment, the mind that is the basis of creativity, and the mind that is the basis of emanation.

original: rtsa ba'i don ni rgyu'i don te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i don ni rgyu'i don te /
translated: The meaning of root is the meaning of cause.

original: ma bsgribs pa la lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab kyang rgyu nyid du rung bas de yang lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa la lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab kyang rgyu nyid du rung bas de yang lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: Because unobstructed indeterminate wisdom is suitable as a cause, it is also the root of the indeterminate.

original: rtsa ba ni sa'i gzhi ltar gyur pa dang rab tu skye ba dang yangs par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba dgongs so //
analyzed: rtsa ba ni sa'i gzhi ltar gyur pa dang rab tu skye ba dang yangs par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba dgongs so //
translated: The root is the basis of the earth, the arising, and the vastness.

original: gzhan dag ni rtsa ba dang 'dra bar rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rtsa ba dang 'dra bar rtsa ba ste /

original: 'di dge ba ma yin pa'i phyir lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di dge ba ma yin pa'i phyir lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because they are not roots of nonvirtue, they are not roots of neutral states.üîΩThe Vaibhasikas of Kasmir say:

original: nyi 'og pa rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //üîΩde la sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba la /

translated: There are four roots of neutral states.

original: gang zhig ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan sgom pa de ni sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan sgom pa de ni sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of one who cultivates meditative attainment concomitant with enjoyment is meditative attainment with strong craving.

original: lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ni gang zhig bsam gtan la brten nas rtog pa la sogs pa'i lta ba skyed pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ni gang zhig bsam gtan la brten nas rtog pa la sogs pa'i lta ba skyed pa'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of one who generates the view of investigation and so on in dependence on the absorptions is meditative attainment with strong view.

original: nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan des bdag ni bsam gtan bzhi thob pa yin gyi /üîΩdge slong gzhan dag ni de lta ma yin no snyam du rlom pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan des bdag ni bsam gtan bzhi thob pa yin gyi / dge slong gzhan dag ni de lta ma yin no snyam du rlom pa'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of one who generates pride and so on in dependence on the absorptions is meditative attainment with strong pride.üîΩThe meditative attainment of one who generates doubt and so on in dependence on the absorptions is meditative attainment with strong doubt.

original: @132b 'di dag kyang bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa nyon mongs pa kun tu spyod pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: @132b 'di dag kyang bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa nyon mongs pa kun tu spyod pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: These are the states of engaging in the branches of affliction when entering meditative attainment.

original: sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nas /üîΩnga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nas / nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /
translated: The meaning of the terms ‚Äúabsorption of craving‚Äù and ‚Äúabsorption of pride‚Äù is as follows:

original: 'di la sred pa lhag pa'i bsam gtan bsgom pa'i ngang tshul yod pas na sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'o //üîΩyang na sred pa shas che ba yang yin la /

original: bsam gtan pa yang yin pas sred ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa yang yin pas sred ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ste /
translated: Or, one is both of craving and an absorption, thus one is an absorption of craving.

original: sred pa lhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / lta ba dang nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sred pa lhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / lta ba dang nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The absorption of pride is also like that.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab ni nyam chung ba'o //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab ni nyam chung ba'o //
translated: The wisdom of the unobscured neutral is weak.

original: bstan pa'i don ni rtsa ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan pa'i don ni rtsa ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is the basic meaning.

original: nga rgyal gyi dbang gis rnal 'byor spyod pa stong phrag rnams kyang nyams par 'gyur la stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa bar nga rgyal lung du ma bstan pa dang 'brel pa bshad do //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi dbang gis rnal 'byor spyod pa stong phrag rnams kyang nyams par 'gyur la stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa bar nga rgyal lung du ma bstan pa dang 'brel pa bshad do //
translated: Because it is powerful, pride is explained as being related to the neutral root of non-virtue.

original: mdo las lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi gsungs pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la ci de dag lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdo las lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi gsungs pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la ci de dag lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The sutras mention fourteen neutral things.

original: dge ba yang ma yin mi dge ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba yang ma yin mi dge ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir yin nam zhes bya ba'o //

original: gzhag par bya ba'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are to be set aside.

original: smra bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: smra bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: They are not to be spoken of.

original: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dga' byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dga' byed do //
translated: Bhadanta RƒÅma says:

original: sems can thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di 'ba' zhig mchog tu lung bstan bar bya ba yin par ma zad kyi thams cad skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yang mgo gcig tu lung du bstan par bya ba yin no //

translated: It is not only the statement, ‚ÄúAll sentient beings die‚Äù that is to be answered categorically, but also the statement, ‚ÄúNo one is born‚Äù is to be answered categorically.

original: slob dpon gyis gang zhig ci zhes bya bas rgyas par lan 'debs so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis gang zhig ci zhes bya bas rgyas par lan 'debs so //
translated: The Master replies, ‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù

original: gang zhig ci gang dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad skye bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba de la ni thams cad ni skye bar mi 'gyur gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig ci gang dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad skye bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba de la ni thams cad ni skye bar mi 'gyur gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If someone asks, ‚ÄúWhat is it? Do all those who die, take birth?‚Äù then the answer is, ‚ÄúNot all take birth.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa skye bar 'gyur gyi /

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya ba yin no //

original: mi la yang gnyi ga yod pas mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba la /
analyzed: mi la yang gnyi ga yod pas mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba la /
translated: But since both are possible for humans, the answer is not categorical.

original: dper na rnam par shes @133a * //
analyzed: dper na rnam par shes @133a * //

original: pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de nyid la dpe smras pa'o //
analyzed: pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de nyid la dpe smras pa'o //

original: slob dpon gyis gcig tu 'dri ba la zhes smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis gcig tu 'dri ba la zhes smos te /
translated: The Master says: ‚ÄúIn the case of a question that is to be rejected.‚Äù

original: dman pa nyid dam khyad par du 'phags pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dman pa nyid dam khyad par du 'phags pa nyid ces bya ba'o //

original: slob dpon gyis gzhag par bya ba gang yin pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis gzhag par bya ba gang yin pa zhes smos te /
translated: The Master says: ‚ÄúIn the case of a question that is to be set aside.‚Äù

original: gzhag par 'os pas na gzhag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhag par 'os pas na gzhag par bya ba ste /
translated: That which is fit to be set aside is to be set aside.

original: de ji ltar na lung du ma bstan par 'gyur /üîΩdon dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / rnam par dbye bar ni mi bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ji ltar na lung du ma bstan par 'gyur / don dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / rnam par dbye bar ni mi bya ste zhes bya ba ni /

original: 'das pa dag dang ma 'ongs pa dag dang de ltar byung ba dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dag dang ma 'ongs pa dag dang de ltar byung ba dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not to be analyzed‚Äù means that it is not to be analyzed in terms of past, future, and present, etc.

original: gang gi tshe de gnyis cung zad kyang ma 'dri'i zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dga' byed kyi'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de gnyis cung zad kyang ma 'dri'i zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dga' byed kyi'o //
translated: When neither of the two is asked about even slightly, this is the position of Bhadanta RƒÅma.

original: gang gi tshe de dag ces rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag ces rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: When they ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the Dharma?‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe de dag ni yon can dang / gang zhig cung zad kyang mi 'dri bar chos dag smros shig ces gsol ba 'debs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag ni yon can dang / gang zhig cung zad kyang mi 'dri bar chos dag smros shig ces gsol ba 'debs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pa'o //

original: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa rgyas pa 'di dag yin no zhes bya bar de dag la cung zad kyang lung mi ston gyi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dag dang / da ltar byung ba dang / chos mang po zhig yod na zhes bya bar 'dri ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad na de ji ltar de gnyis kyi dri ba yin /
analyzed: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa rgyas pa 'di dag yin no zhes bya bar de dag la cung zad kyang lung mi ston gyi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dag dang / da ltar byung ba dang / chos mang po zhig yod na zhes bya bar 'dri ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad na de ji ltar de gnyis kyi dri ba yin /
translated: They do not request any instruction on these topics, but they do ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the Dharma?‚Äù and ‚ÄúThere are many dharmas, past, future, and present.‚Äù How can this be a question of those two?

original: ji ltar na lung du bstan pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na lung du bstan pa yin /

original: slob dpon gyis gang zhig ces bya bas chos mngon pa pa'i phyogs gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis gang zhig ces bya bas chos mngon pa pa'i phyogs gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //

original: de mi shes ba gang zhig la ma smros shig ces zer na ci des lam ma dris pa yin nam /
analyzed: de mi shes ba gang zhig la ma smros shig ces zer na ci des lam ma dris pa yin nam /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúDo not speak of what is unknown,‚Äù then is it not the case that the path is not asked about?

original: dri ba nyid kyis de lung bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri ba nyid kyis de lung bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the question itself is an indication of the answer.

original: 'dir chos kyi rnam par dbye bas mthar phyin na 'dri ba po'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don khong du chud pas de lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir chos kyi rnam par dbye bas mthar phyin na 'dri ba po'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don khong du chud pas de lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, if the questioner has reached the limit of the classification of phenomena, then the questioner understands the meaning that is desired and the question is an indication of the answer.

original: gang zhig ma bshad par 'di mi rtogs la /
analyzed: gang zhig ma bshad par 'di mi rtogs la /
translated: That which is not understood without explanation,

original: bshad pas rtogs ba de la de lung bstan pas lung bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pas rtogs ba de la de lung bstan pas lung bstan par bya ste /

original: des zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dga' byed do //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dga' byed do //

original: 'di ltar gang zhig lam smros shig ces smra ba la de mi shes pas dris nas lung ston pa ste 'di ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig lam smros shig ces smra ba la de mi shes pas dris nas lung ston pa ste 'di ni khyad par ro //

original: de nyid la dris nas rang gis lung ston @133b pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid la dris nas rang gis lung ston @133b pa ste /

original: ji ltar khyod nyid la dris /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod nyid la dris /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as you ask me,üîΩyou should answer as you are able.‚Äù

original: khyod kyis ji ltar nus pa de bzhin du lan thob cig / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: khyod kyis ji ltar nus pa de bzhin du lan thob cig / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat do you think, Nanda?

original: gzugs mi rtag pa'am rtag pa yin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag pa'am rtag pa yin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnams so //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la dris pa khong du mi chud pa la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di lung du mi ston te cang mi gsung bar gyur pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la dris pa khong du mi chud pa la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di lung du mi ston te cang mi gsung bar gyur pa /
translated: The Lord does not answer a question that is not pertinent to the TathƒÅgata.

original: 'di lung du ston pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'di lung du ston pa gzhan yin no //
translated: This is a different kind of answer.

original: de'i phyir 'di khyad par dang bcas pa'i lung ston pa ste lung ston pa'i thabs su gyur pa dris nas lung ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di khyad par dang bcas pa'i lung ston pa ste lung ston pa'i thabs su gyur pa dris nas lung ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is an answer with a distinction, a method of answering, and is called an answer by questioning.

original: de bzhin du gnyis la zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /üîΩde rig par bya ba la dri bas lung bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis la zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te / de rig par bya ba la dri bas lung bstan par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, the phrase ‚Äúin two ways‚Äù should be applied to the other questions.üîΩThe answer by distinguishing should be given to the question, ‚ÄúIs the self the same as the body or different from the body?‚Äù

original: dri bas lung ston pas na 'di ni dri bas zhes bya'o //üîΩched du bsam par bya ba'i las byas nas ci zhig so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /üîΩci bde ba 'am /
analyzed: dri bas lung ston pas na 'di ni dri bas zhes bya'o // ched du bsam par bya ba'i las byas nas ci zhig so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni / ci bde ba 'am /
translated: This is called an answer by distinguishing because it is an answer by distinguishing.üîΩThe answer by countering should be given to the question, ‚ÄúIs the self the same as the body or different from the body?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer by countering should be given to the question, ‚ÄúIs the self the same as the body or different from the body?‚Äù

analyzed: sdug bsngal lam bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The answer by countering should be given to the question, ‚ÄúIs the self the same as the body or different from the body?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer by countering should be given to the question, ‚ÄúIs the self the same as the body or different from the body?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer by countering should be given to the question, ‚ÄúIs the self the same as the body or different from the body?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer by countering should be given to the question, ‚ÄúIs the self the same as the body or different from the body?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer by countering should be given to the question, ‚ÄúIs the self the same as the body or different from the body?‚Äù

original: rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya ste /
translated: The answer by countering should be given to the question, ‚ÄúIs the self the same as the body or different from the body?‚Äù

original: ched du bsam par bya ba'i las ni rnam pa gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ched du bsam par bya ba'i las ni rnam pa gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there are three types of karma to be experienced.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar gyi ched du bsam par bya ba'i las dge ba zag pa bcas pa byas nas ni bde ba kho na so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar gyi ched du bsam par bya ba'i las dge ba zag pa bcas pa byas nas ni bde ba kho na so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having performed virtuous karma to be experienced in the three meditations, one experiences only pleasure.

original: gzhan dag na re bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa yang ngo zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa yang ngo zhe'o //

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la sogs pa'i ched du bsam par bya ba'i las byas nas ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la sogs pa'i ched du bsam par bya ba'i las byas nas ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Having performed karma to be experienced in the fourth meditation and so on, one experiences neither pleasure nor pain.

original: ched du bsam par bya ba'i las mi dge ba byas nas ni sdug bsngal so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ched du bsam par bya ba'i las mi dge ba byas nas ni sdug bsngal so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having performed nonvirtuous karma to be experienced, one experiences pain.

original: rags pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rags pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term ‚Äúcoarse‚Äù means ‚Äúhaving form.‚Äù

original: de'i dngos po ma yin pa la rgyud kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba la dngos po rnam pa du ma yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ma yin pa la rgyud kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba la dngos po rnam pa du ma yod mod kyi /
translated: Although there are many types of entities, they are included in the two: form and non-form.

original: 'dir ni ldan pa'i dngos po kho na mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni ldan pa'i dngos po kho na mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Here, only the possession of the factors is accepted.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And that is twofold:

original: rten dang dmigs pa des pa dang rnam par des pas so //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa des pa dang rnam par des pas so //
translated: determined by the basis and object, and undetermined.

original: de la re zhig rten dang dmigs pa nges pas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i phra rgyas rnams kyis ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas gzugs dag dang ldan par byed la /üîΩde @134a * //
analyzed: de la re zhig rten dang dmigs pa nges pas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i phra rgyas rnams kyis ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas gzugs dag dang ldan par byed la / de @134a * //
translated: First, the negative tendencies of eye consciousness make one possess form by way of the object.

original: dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag dang ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ldan par byed do //
analyzed: dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag dang ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ldan par byed do //
translated: And they make one possess the factors concomitant with it by way of concomitance.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i phra rgyas rnams kyis ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas reg bya dang ldan par byed la /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i phra rgyas rnams kyis ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas reg bya dang ldan par byed la /
translated: The negative tendencies of body consciousness make one possess tactile objects by way of the object.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag dang ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ldan par byed pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag dang ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ldan par byed pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: And they make one possess the factors concomitant with it by way of concomitance.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i phra rgyas rnams kyis ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas skye mched bcu gnyis dang ldan par byed la /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i phra rgyas rnams kyis ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas skye mched bcu gnyis dang ldan par byed la /
translated: Negative tendencies of the mental consciousness are possessed by means of the focal object, since they possess the twelve sense bases.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag dang ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ldan par byed do //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag dang ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ldan par byed do //
translated: They are possessed by means of concomitance, since they are concomitant with the mental consciousness.

original: kun 'gro ba ma yin pa rnams kyis ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni rang gi sa pa dag dang ldan par byed do //
analyzed: kun 'gro ba ma yin pa rnams kyis ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni rang gi sa pa dag dang ldan par byed do //
translated: Nonpervasive negative tendencies are possessed by means of the focal object, since they possess the level of their own realm.

original: de dag mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ldan par byed do //
analyzed: de dag mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas ldan par byed do //
translated: They are possessed by means of concomitance, since they are concomitant with the mental consciousness.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la ci rigs par khong du chud par bya'o //üîΩ'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i nges pas 'das pa ni gang dang ldan zhes bya ba nas da ltar byung bas ni gang dang ldan zhes bya ba'i bar de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la ci rigs par khong du chud par bya'o // 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i nges pas 'das pa ni gang dang ldan zhes bya ba nas da ltar byung bas ni gang dang ldan zhes bya ba'i bar de brjod par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood in the same way for all the other realms.üîΩThe question should be asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the past possessed of? What is the future possessed of? What is the present possessed of?‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The answer is that the past is possessed of past and present afflictions that are specific to the level.

original: 'dod chags ni rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Attachment is called a specific affliction.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni de la dmigs pa'i bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i dngos po rang gi ngo bo las bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba nyid kyis dngos po la dmigs te skye'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni de la dmigs pa'i bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i dngos po rang gi ngo bo las bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba nyid kyis dngos po la dmigs te skye'o //
translated: Specific afflictions arise focusing on the entity that is the object of experience of pleasure, etc., because the entity is the nature of the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: de bzhin du nga rgyal yang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i sems mtho ba yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du nga rgyal yang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i sems mtho ba yin la /
translated: Similarly, pride is the exaltation of mind that focuses on the entity that is the object of experience of pleasure.üîΩAnger arises focusing on the entity that is the object of experience of pain.

original: khong khro yang sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po la dmigs te skye bas de dag rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa yin no //üîΩnyon mongs pa spyi pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khong khro yang sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po la dmigs te skye bas de dag rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa yin no // nyon mongs pa spyi pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore they are specific afflictions.

original: de la dmigs pa'i phyir de dag khyad par med par bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad las skye bas nyon mongs pa spyi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i phyir de dag khyad par med par bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad las skye bas nyon mongs pa spyi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called general afflictions because they arise in relation to all entities that are the objects of experience of pleasure, etc., without distinction, since they focus on them.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal rnams zhes khyad par med par brjod pas ci rigs par rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug pa dag yin @134b par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal rnams zhes khyad par med par brjod pas ci rigs par rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug pa dag yin @134b par shes par bya'o //
translated: Since it is said without distinction that ‚Äúpast and present attachment, anger, and pride,‚Äù they should be understood as the six collections of consciousness in the appropriate way.

original: dngos po gang la zhes bya bas sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dus gsum pa dang bsgom pa dang spang bar bya ba'i dngos po la zhes ston to //
analyzed: dngos po gang la zhes bya bas sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dus gsum pa dang bsgom pa dang spang bar bya ba'i dngos po la zhes ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin regard to a thing‚Äù indicates that it is in regard to things to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, and in regard to things to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: dngos po de dang zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i dngos po kho na dang spyar te /
analyzed: dngos po de dang zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i dngos po kho na dang spyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin regard to that thing‚Äù is to be connected with the just mentioned thing.

original: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi thams cad la gdon mi za bar mi skye bas gang la skyes pa zhes khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi thams cad la gdon mi za bar mi skye bas gang la skyes pa zhes khyad par du byas so //
translated: Since they are afflictions that are specific characteristics, they do not necessarily arise in regard to all things. Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúthat have arisen‚Äù is specified.

original: yid kyi de dag ma 'ongs pas kun dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid kyi de dag ma 'ongs pas kun dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe future ones with all‚Äù indicates that future ones are associated with all.

original: nyon mongs pa gang zhig 'das pa'i rnam pa spang pa dang ma 'ongs pa de dang de spang ba nyid yin pas de'i phyir khyad par du byas so //üîΩgang du spangs pa de zhes bya ba la dngos po thams cad la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang zhig 'das pa'i rnam pa spang pa dang ma 'ongs pa de dang de spang ba nyid yin pas de'i phyir khyad par du byas so // gang du spangs pa de zhes bya ba la dngos po thams cad la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The object to be abandoned is distinguished by the object, because the object is abandoned when the object to be abandoned is abandoned.üîΩThe object to be abandoned is distinguished by the realm, because the object to be abandoned in the desire realm is abandoned in the desire realm, and so on.

original: de la dmigs pa rnams la skye ba srid pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa rnams la skye ba srid pa'i phyir te //
translated: The object to be abandoned is distinguished by the level, because the object to be abandoned on the first absorption level is abandoned on the first absorption level, and so on.

original: yid kyi yul ni dus gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi yul ni dus gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object to be abandoned is distinguished by the time period, because the object to be abandoned in the past is abandoned in the past, and so on.

original: gzhan gyis rang dus pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩrnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni rang gi dus pa kho na la dmigs nas skye ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rang dus pa zhes bya ba la / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni rang gi dus pa kho na la dmigs nas skye ste /
translated: The object to be abandoned is distinguished by the person, because the object to be abandoned by one person is abandoned by that person alone.

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa de dag gi dmigs pa ni ma 'ongs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa de dag gi dmigs pa ni ma 'ongs pa kho na'o //
translated: The object to be abandoned is distinguished by the aspect, because the object to be abandoned by the aspect of impermanence is abandoned by the aspect of impermanence, and so on.üîΩThe object to be abandoned is distinguished by the root, because the object to be abandoned by the root of attachment is abandoned by the root of attachment, and so on.üîΩThe object to be abandoned is distinguished by the path, because the object to be abandoned by the path of seeing is abandoned by the path of seeing, and so on.üîΩThe object to be abandoned is distinguished by the truth, because the object to be abandoned by the truth of suffering is abandoned by the truth of suffering, and so on.üîΩThe object to be abandoned is distinguished by the time period, because the object to be abandoned in the past is abandoned in the past, and so on.

original: da ltar ba rnams kyi ni da ltar ba yin la //
analyzed: da ltar ba rnams kyi ni da ltar ba yin la //
translated: The object to be abandoned is distinguished by the person, because the object to be abandoned by one person is abandoned by that person alone.

original: 'das pa rnams kyi ni 'das pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'das pa rnams kyi ni 'das pa ma yin pas /
translated: The object to be abandoned is distinguished by the aspect, because the object to be abandoned by the aspect of impermanence is abandoned by the aspect of impermanence, and so on.

original: de dag gis rang gi sa pa'i dmigs pa kho na dang ldan no //
analyzed: de dag gis rang gi sa pa'i dmigs pa kho na dang ldan no //
translated: The object to be abandoned is distinguished by the root, because the object to be abandoned by the root of attachment is abandoned by the root of attachment, and so on.üîΩThe object to be abandoned is distinguished by the path, because the object to be abandoned by the path of seeing is abandoned by the path of seeing, and so on.

original: mi skye ba rnams kyi thams cad dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi skye ba rnams kyi thams cad dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: All of those that are not produced.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa mi skye ba'i chos can rnams las ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa mi skye ba'i chos can rnams las ni /
translated: Among the five collections of consciousness, attachment and so on that are not produced are objects of those that are produced.

original: kha cig gi dmigs pa ni 'das pa yin la ;
analyzed: kha cig gi dmigs pa ni 'das pa yin la ;
translated: Some of those that are not produced are objects of the past,

original: kha cig gi ni da ltar ba yin zhing kha cig gi ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig gi ni da ltar ba yin zhing kha cig gi ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: some are objects of the present, and some are objects of the future.

original: de'i phyir de dag gis thams cad dang ldan par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gis thams cad dang ldan par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are associated with all.

original: lhag ma kun gyis kun dang ldan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma kun gyis kun dang ldan zhes bya ba la /
translated: All of the remaining ones are associated with all.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba rnams kyis so //
translated: The past, future, and present are associated with all.

original: kun dang ldan zhes bya ba ni dngos po dus gsum pa rnam pa lnga char yang ngo //
analyzed: kun dang ldan zhes bya ba ni dngos po dus gsum pa rnam pa lnga char yang ngo //
translated: All means the five aspects of all things in the three times.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: The reason for that is stated:

original: nyon mongs pa spyi ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spyi ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because they are general afflictions.

original: de dag ni thams cad kyi dngos po thams cad las skye ste /
analyzed: de dag ni thams cad kyi dngos po thams cad las skye ste /
translated: They are produced from all things.

original: des na 'das pa rnams kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar 'byung ba'i dngos po dang ldan @135a * //
analyzed: des na 'das pa rnams kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar 'byung ba'i dngos po dang ldan @135a * //
translated: Therefore, past things are endowed with the entities of past, future, and present.

original: no ; / de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa rnams dang da ltar ba rnams kyis kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba'i dngos po dang ldan no //
analyzed: no ; / de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa rnams dang da ltar ba rnams kyis kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba'i dngos po dang ldan no //
translated: Similarly, future and present things are endowed with the entities of past, future, and present.üîΩDo past and future things exist substantially?üîΩDo they exist by their own intrinsic reality and by their own intrinsic identity, as does the present? Or do they not exist?

original: ci 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa 'di rdzas su yod dam zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba dang 'dra bar rang gi ngo bo dang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod dam 'on te med ces bya ba ni da ltar ba ltar rang gi ngo bos med cesüîΩbya ba'o // 'o na ma 'ongs pa ni rang gi ngo bos ma thob pa'i phyir dang / 'das pa ni rang gi ngo bo 'gag pa'i phyir dus thams cad du yod pa zhes bya ba ci /
analyzed: ci 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa 'di rdzas su yod dam zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba dang 'dra bar rang gi ngo bo dang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod dam 'on te med ces bya ba ni da ltar ba ltar rang gi ngo bos med cesüîΩbya ba'o // 'o na ma 'ongs pa ni rang gi ngo bos ma thob pa'i phyir dang / 'das pa ni rang gi ngo bo 'gag pa'i phyir dus thams cad du yod pa zhes bya ba ci /
translated: Do they not exist by their own intrinsic reality, as does the present?üîΩIf the future does not exist by its own intrinsic reality because it has not yet been obtained, and if the past does not exist by its own intrinsic reality because it has already ceased, how can it be said that they exist in all three times?

original: da ltar ba nyid 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag na yang yod na rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba nyid 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag na yang yod na rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it existed in the present state of the past and future, then it would follow that it is permanent.

original: ji ltar de dang zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar de dang zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dang ngo //
translated: How is it like that? The past and future entities.

original: des zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pas so //
translated: By that means the past and future defilements.

original: ldan pa 'am bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ldan pa 'am bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not associated with or dissociated from.

original: med pa ni med pa dang ldan pa'am bral bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: med pa ni med pa dang ldan pa'am bral bar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that the nonexistent is associated with or dissociated from the nonexistent.

original: gnyi ga yang ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are absolutely nonexistent.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus byas rnams rtag pa nyid du dam mi 'cha'i zhes bya ba la 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas dus su 'pho bar 'jug pa yin la ;
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus byas rnams rtag pa nyid du dam mi 'cha'i zhes bya ba la 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas dus su 'pho bar 'jug pa yin la ;
translated: The conditioned are not permanent because they possess the characteristics of the conditioned. The conditioned dharmas are engaged in the transference of time through the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: dus dag la 'jug pa rnams ni rtag pa nyid du yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dus dag la 'jug pa rnams ni rtag pa nyid du yang mi rung ngo //
translated: And it is not tenable that those engaged in time are permanent.

original: gsal ba dam 'cha'o zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba ltar rang gi ngo bos yod pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: gsal ba dam 'cha'o zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba ltar rang gi ngo bos yod pa nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWe assert that it is clear‚Äù means that it exists by its own nature, just as it is in the present.

original: ci'i phyir de rnams kyis de de ltar dam 'cha' ste ci lung ngam rigs pa'am /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de rnams kyis de de ltar dam 'cha' ste ci lung ngam rigs pa'am /
translated: Why do they assert that? Is it on the basis of scripture, reasoning, or both?

original: gnyi ga la brten nas yin zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la brten nas yin zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: This is the thought behind the question.

original: gsungs phyir zhes bya bas re zhig lung ston pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs phyir zhes bya bas re zhig lung ston pa ste /
translated: The response ‚Äúbecause it is stated‚Äù indicates that the Buddha‚Äôs scriptures are the basis for the assertion.

original: gang gi phyir 'das pa'i gzugs yod cing ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs yod pa zhes mgur nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'das pa'i gzugs yod cing ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs yod pa zhes mgur nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: The Buddha stated that the past and future exist, because he said, ‚ÄúPast form exists and future form exists.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir da ltar byung ba nye bar ma bkod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir da ltar byung ba nye bar ma bkod ce na /
translated: Why did he not state that the present exists?üîΩThe Buddha said, ‚ÄúMonks, if present form did not exist, then the noble disciples who have heard the teachings would not engage in renunciation, freedom from attachment, and cessation.‚Äù

original: dge slong dag da ltar byung ba'i gzugs yod par ma gyur na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag yid 'byung ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes gnyi ga la mi mthun pa smra ba med
analyzed: dge slong dag da ltar byung ba'i gzugs yod par ma gyur na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag yid 'byung ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes gnyi ga la mi mthun pa smra ba med
translated: There is no disagreement about both.

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the arising of consciousness.

original: gnyis la brten nas zhes bya @135b ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gnyis la brten nas zhes bya @135b ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: ‚Äú In dependence on two‚Äù is the extended form.

original: 'dir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du don gyis gsungs so zhes bya ba ni sngar dngos su gsungs pa las khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du don gyis gsungs so zhes bya ba ni sngar dngos su gsungs pa las khyad par yin no //
translated: Here, the existence of the past and future is implied, but not explicitly stated, as it was in the previous verse.

original: 'dir ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas yid dang chos kyi bar la brten nas zhes rnam par shes pa drug gis rten dang dmigs pa nges par brjod na /üîΩgal te khyad par med par brjod kyang /
analyzed: 'dir ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas yid dang chos kyi bar la brten nas zhes rnam par shes pa drug gis rten dang dmigs pa nges par brjod na / gal te khyad par med par brjod kyang /
translated: Here, the six consciousnesses are described in terms of their specific supports and objects, ‚Äúin dependence on the eye and forms, up to in dependence on the mind and mental objects.‚Äù

original: yul med par yang rnam par shes pa skye bar rtog na ni /
analyzed: yul med par yang rnam par shes pa skye bar rtog na ni /
translated: If you claim that consciousness can arise without an object,üîΩthen why don‚Äôt you claim that the consciousness of the blind can arise without a support?

original: de ltar na long ba la sogs pa rnams la rten med par yang rnam par shes pa skye bar ci ste mi rtog / khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na long ba la sogs pa rnams la rten med par yang rnam par shes pa skye bar ci ste mi rtog / khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no reason to make such a distinction.

original: dngos po med pa yul drug gi khongs su ma 'dus pas dngos po med pa'i yul can gyi blo yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yul drug gi khongs su ma 'dus pas dngos po med pa'i yul can gyi blo yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since nonthings are not included among the six objects, there is no cognition that has a nonthing as its object.

original: de bas na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, because there is no object, consciousness itself would not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa ni dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa yin na rnam par shes par bya ba med na ni 'dis cung zad kyang rnam par mi shes pas des na rnam par shes pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni dngos po so sor rnam par rig pa yin na rnam par shes par bya ba med na ni 'dis cung zad kyang rnam par mi shes pas des na rnam par shes pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Consciousness is the discernment of individual things. If there is no object of consciousness, it does not cognize anything at all. Therefore, consciousness itself would not exist.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid med na des ci zhig khong du chud par bya zhing rnam par shes par bya ba yin /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid med na des ci zhig khong du chud par bya zhing rnam par shes par bya ba yin /
translated: If there were no specific or general characteristics, what would be understood and cognized by that consciousness?

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i tshe ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i tshe ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: When the effect arises, etc.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i phyir 'gags na ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i phyir 'gags na ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Because wholesome and unwholesome karma ceases after a long time, it does not exist when it ceases.

original: de lta yin na rgyu med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mi skye ba zhig go / rgyu med pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na rgyu med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mi skye ba zhig go / rgyu med pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were so, the effect of karmic maturation would not arise because there would be no cause, and what is causeless does not arise because that would lead to an absurd conclusion.

original: gdon mi za bar 'di khas blang bar bya ba dgos so zhes grag ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'di khas blang bar bya ba dgos so zhes grag ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: It is well known that they must definitely accept this.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bya ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bya ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term Sarvastivada is a reason for action.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: de yod smra ba'i phyir thams cad yod par smra ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de yod smra ba'i phyir thams cad yod par smra ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is called Sarvastivada because it advocates the existence of all.

original: dus gsum la thams cad kyi sgra nges par bkod pa'i phyir thams cad kyi sgras dus gsum brjod do //
analyzed: dus gsum la thams cad kyi sgra nges par bkod pa'i phyir thams cad kyi sgras dus gsum brjod do //
translated: The term all refers to the three times because the term all is definitely applied to the three times.

original: sde pa gzhan 'bras bu ma skyes pa yod pa nyid smra ba rnams ni rnam par phye ste smra ba'o //
analyzed: sde pa gzhan 'bras bu ma skyes pa yod pa nyid smra ba rnams ni rnam par phye ste smra ba'o //
translated: Other schools that advocate the existence of future results are called Vibhajyavadins.

original: mdo sde ba rnams ni da ltar byung ba tsam smra ba'o //
analyzed: mdo sde ba rnams ni da ltar byung ba tsam smra ba'o //
translated: Sautrantikas advocate the mere existence of the present.

original: chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na dngos po gzhan du 'gyur gyi zhes @136a * //
analyzed: chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na dngos po gzhan du 'gyur gyi zhes @136a * //
translated: When phenomena engage the three times, they transform into other things.

original: bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: This means that future and so on transform into other things.

original: 'dir ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po 'dor zhing da ltar ba'i dngos por 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po 'dor zhing da ltar ba'i dngos por 'gyur la /
translated: Here, the future entity is discarded and the present entity arises.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dngos po 'dor zhing 'das pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro //üîΩrdzas gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dngos po 'dor zhing 'das pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro // rdzas gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: The present entity is discarded and the past entity arises.üîΩBut there is no transformation of substance.

original: dngos po dus rnams su 'jug pa ni rang bzhin 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan du gzhan nyid du ste /
analyzed: dngos po dus rnams su 'jug pa ni rang bzhin 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan du gzhan nyid du ste /
translated: The substance itself does not transform, because the nature of an entity that is engaged in the three times is not confused.

original: ma 'ongs pa las gzhan da ltar byung ba la sogs pa dang 'das pa zhes bya bar de thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa las gzhan da ltar byung ba la sogs pa dang 'das pa zhes bya bar de thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were transformation, then the future would be different from the future, and the present and the past would be different from the present and the past.

original: yang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: But what is this entity that is future, etc.?

original: gang las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i shes pa dang brjod pa 'jug pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: gang las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i shes pa dang brjod pa 'jug pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ro //
translated: It is a special quality from which the cognition and expression of the past, future, and present occur.

original: dper na gser gyi snod ces bya ba ni de nyid la dpe gnyis po gser dang 'o ma ste /
analyzed: dper na gser gyi snod ces bya ba ni de nyid la dpe gnyis po gser dang 'o ma ste /
translated: For example, a golden vessel is called ‚Äúgolden‚Äù because of two reasons: gold and milk.

original: 'di ltar gnyi g-yang kha dog la sogs pa tshogs pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyi g-yang kha dog la sogs pa tshogs pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: In this way, both are the nature of a collection of color, etc.

original: de la yang dpung rgyan dang gdu bu la sogs pa brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan yon tan dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid tsam kho na zhig gzhan du 'gyur ba yin gyi kha dog ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dpung rgyan dang gdu bu la sogs pa brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan yon tan dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid tsam kho na zhig gzhan du 'gyur ba yin gyi kha dog ni ma yin no //
translated: And in that, only the mere nature of the qualities and shape, such as a bracelet, a bangle, etc., are the reasons for the designation, but not the color.

original: de bzhin du 'o ma dang zho dang dar ba la sogs pa brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa dang / mthu rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin gyi kha dog ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'o ma dang zho dang dar ba la sogs pa brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa dang / mthu rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin gyi kha dog ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the reasons for the designation of milk, curd, cream, etc., are the taste, potency, ripening, and efficacy, which are the reasons for the designation, but not the color.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni mtshan nyid 'jug pa la thob pa la bltos nas tha snyad 'dogs te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni mtshan nyid 'jug pa la thob pa la bltos nas tha snyad 'dogs te /
translated: The transformation of characteristics is the designation of a characteristic in dependence on the engagement of the characteristic.

original: dper na skyes bu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, a person is called ‚Äúa man‚Äù

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'jug pa thob pa dang ma thob pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'jug pa thob pa dang ma thob pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: The difference is that the one who has obtained entry to the detachment of its nature and the one who has not obtained it.

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dag mi ldan par gyur pa de lta na ma 'ongs pa nyid 'byung ba ma yin zhing 'das par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dag mi ldan par gyur pa de lta na ma 'ongs pa nyid 'byung ba ma yin zhing 'das par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the future, the past, and the present did not exist as non-possession, then the future would not arise and the past would not exist.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa da ltar byung ba mi ldan par gyur pas ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang 'das par yang mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa da ltar byung ba mi ldan par gyur pas ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang 'das par yang mi 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: bya'o // 'o na ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that homogeneous causes and so onüîΩare causes that produce results,üîΩwe respond: there are three causes:

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams so //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams so //
translated: homogeneous causes, omnipresent causes, and causes of karmic maturation.üîΩBecause they produce results and because they hold results,

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la rgyu mthun pa dang / gal te bya ba so sor bar 'dod na bya ba yod par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la rgyu mthun pa dang / gal te bya ba so sor bar 'dod na bya ba yod par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: if you assert that they have a function, it follows that they would exist as active things.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa yang da ltar ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa yang da ltar ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that the past would be the present.

original: bya ba byed du zhes bya ba la gal te 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa mtha' dag bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: bya ba byed du zhes bya ba la gal te 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa mtha' dag bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If the activity of the effect is asserted to be the activity of the cause,

original: de lta na bya ba yang snga ma bzhin du snga ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na bya ba yang snga ma bzhin du snga ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the activity would be prior to the cause, as before.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: dngos po rnams kyis bya ba'i 'bras bu 'phen pa'i nus pa ni 'bras bu 'byin pa ma yin pas mtshan nyid 'chol ba med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyis bya ba'i 'bras bu 'phen pa'i nus pa ni 'bras bu 'byin pa ma yin pas mtshan nyid 'chol ba med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Since the potency of a thing to project its effect is not the activity of producing the effect, there is no confusion of characteristics.

original: nus pa 'ba' zhig bya ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa 'ba' zhig bya ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: Potency is not just activity.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: de las tha dad pa'i nus pa yang yod do //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i nus pa yang yod do //
translated: It is the distinct potency of that.

original: de bzhin du min pa la mig las tha dad pa'i nus pa 'joms pa'i bya ba med pas //
analyzed: de bzhin du min pa la mig las tha dad pa'i nus pa 'joms pa'i bya ba med pas //
translated: Similarly, in the case of the eye, since there is no activity of destroying the potency distinct from the eye,

original: gang yang 'gags pa skyes pa 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi mthu'i khyad par dngos po gzhan skyes pa la rgyur gyur pa 'di dag gi nus pa nyid bya ba ma yin pa da ltar ba'i gnas skabs kho na 'phangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang 'gags pa skyes pa 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi mthu'i khyad par dngos po gzhan skyes pa la rgyur gyur pa 'di dag gi nus pa nyid bya ba ma yin pa da ltar ba'i gnas skabs kho na 'phangs pa'i phyir /
translated: The power of things that are produced, that is, conditioned phenomena, is the cause of the arising of another thing.

original: 'dus ma byas rnams kyis 'bras bu 'phen pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams kyis 'bras bu 'phen pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The power of unconditioned phenomena to project a result is untenable.

original: 'bras bu 'phen pa'i bya ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'phen pa'i bya ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: The activity of projecting a result is the activity of a cause.

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa'i bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa'i bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The activity of producing a result is not the activity of a cause.

original: yang ci bya ba zhes bya ba'i nus pa de las gzhan pa'i dngos po rnams ma byung ba las byung zhing /
analyzed: yang ci bya ba zhes bya ba'i nus pa de las gzhan pa'i dngos po rnams ma byung ba las byung zhing /
translated: Moreover, does the power called activity arise from a thing that did not exist previously and then disintegrate?

original: byung nas kyang 'jig pa'i phyir rdzas de rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byung nas kyang 'jig pa'i phyir rdzas de rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it does, then that substance does not exist as permanent.

original: gal te ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas 'jig pa'i rdzas las gzhan ma yin pa'i rdzas su yod pa de skye ba dang 'jig pa nyid /
analyzed: gal te ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas 'jig pa'i rdzas las gzhan ma yin pa'i rdzas su yod pa de skye ba dang 'jig pa nyid /
translated: If the power called activity does not arise from a thing that did not exist previously and does not disintegrate after arising, then it is not different from a substance.

original: skye ba dang 'jig par khas blang bar bya na 'di nyid la skye ba dang mi skye ba dang 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa zhes bya ba dag mi rigs so //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig par khas blang bar bya na 'di nyid la skye ba dang mi skye ba dang 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa zhes bya ba dag mi rigs so //
translated: If you accept that it arises and is destroyed, then it is illogical to say that it is both arisen and not arisen, and destroyed and not destroyed.

original: nus pa snga ma dang nus pa phyi ma yongs su 'gyur bar rtog pa la nus pa thams cad nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / nus pa dang nus pa ma yin pa med pa de'i phyir gzhan nyid du khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: nus pa snga ma dang nus pa phyi ma yongs su 'gyur bar rtog pa la nus pa thams cad nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / nus pa dang nus pa ma yin pa med pa de'i phyir gzhan nyid du khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: If you imagine that the prior capacity and the subsequent capacity transform, then all capacities would definitely be without a cause, and because there would be no capacity or noncapacity, you would have to accept that they are different.
